  4516                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4517                                  
  4518                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4519                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4520                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4521                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4522                                  ;
  4523                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4524                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4525                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4526                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4527                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4528                                  ;	  and a retf
  4529                                  
  4530                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4531                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4532                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4533                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4534                                  
  4535                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4536                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4537 00001763 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4538                                  
  4539                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4540                                  
  4541                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4542 00001765 2EFF36[6317]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4543                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4544 0000176A 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4545 0000176F 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4546 00001770 CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4547                                  
  4548                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4549                                  
  4550 00001771 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4551                                  
  4552                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4553                                  
  4554                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4555                                  
  4556                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4557                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4558                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4559                                  
  4560                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4561                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4562                                  		;=============================================================
  4563                                  		;
  4564                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4565                                  		;
  4566                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4567                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4568                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4569                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4570                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4571                                  
  4572                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4573                                  		;=============================================================
  4574                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4575                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4576                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4577                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4578                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4579                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4580                                  
  4581                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4582                                  		; (from MSLOAD)
  4583                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h, bp = any, ds = previous cs  
  4584                                  		
  4585 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4586                                  
  4587                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4588                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4589                                  		;push	ax
  4590                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4591                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4592                                  		;pop	ax
  4593                                  	
  4594                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4595                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4596                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4597                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4598                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4599                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4600                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4601                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4602                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4603                                  
  4604                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4605                                  
  4606                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4607                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4608                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4609                                  
  4610 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4611 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4612                                  
  4613                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4614                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4615                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4616                                  
  4617 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4618 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4619 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4620 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4621                                  
  4622                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4623                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4624                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4625                                  		; ds = cs
  4626 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4627 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4628                                  		; ds = 0
  4629                                  
  4630 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4631                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4632                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4633                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4634 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4635                                  next_int_:		
  4636 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4637 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4638                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4639 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4640 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4641 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4642 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4643 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4644                                  					; saving address in di
  4645                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4646                                  		;stosw
  4647                                  		;lodsw			; movsw
  4648                                  		;stosw			; save the vector
  4649                                  		; 28/09/2023
  4650 00001794 A5                      		movsw
  4651 00001795 A5                      		movsw
  4652                                  
  4653 00001796 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4654 00001798 E2EF                    		loop	next_int_
  4655 0000179A 5F                      		pop	di
  4656 0000179B 59                      		pop	cx
  4657                                  
  4658                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4659                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4660                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4661                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4662                                  
  4663                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4664                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4665                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4666                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4667                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4668                                  
  4669                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4670 0000179C C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4671                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4672                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4673 000017A2 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4674                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4675 000017A6 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4676                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4677                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4678 000017AC 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4679                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4680 000017B0 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4681                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4682                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4683 000017B6 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4684                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4685                                  
  4686                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4687 000017BA 0E                      		push	cs
  4688 000017BB 1F                      		pop	ds
  4689                                  		
  4690 000017BC A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4691 000017BF A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4692 000017C2 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4693 000017C5 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4694                                  					; ;
  4695 000017C8 FB                      		sti
  4696 000017C9 CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4697                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4698                                  
  4699                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4700                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4701                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4702                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4703                                  ;
  4704                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4705                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4706                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4707                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4708                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4709                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4710                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4711                                  
  4712                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4713                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4714                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4715                                  ;
  4716                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4717                                  ; to do anything special.
  4718                                  ;
  4719                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4720                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4721                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4722                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4723                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4724                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4725                                  
  4726                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4727 000017CB A801                    		test	al, 1
  4728                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4729 000017CD 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4730                                  
  4731                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4732                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4733                                  ;
  4734                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4735                                  ;
  4736                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4737                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4738                                  
  4739 000017CF 50                      		push	ax
  4740 000017D0 53                      		push	bx
  4741 000017D1 51                      		push	cx
  4742 000017D2 52                      		push	dx
  4743 000017D3 57                      		push	di
  4744 000017D4 06                      		push	es
  4745 000017D5 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4746 000017D7 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4747 000017D9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4748                                  					; DL = drive number
  4749                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4750                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4751                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4752 000017DB 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4753                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4754                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4755                                  		; ds = cs
  4756 000017DD 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4757                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4758 000017E1 07                      		pop	es
  4759 000017E2 5F                      		pop	di
  4760 000017E3 5A                      		pop	dx
  4761 000017E4 59                      		pop	cx
  4762 000017E5 5B                      		pop	bx
  4763 000017E6 58                      		pop	ax
  4764 000017E7 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4765                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4766                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4767                                  
  4768                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4769                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4770                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4771                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4772 000017E9 A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4773 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4774 000017EE 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4775                                  
  4776                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4777                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4778 000017F0 48                      		dec	ax
  4779 000017F1 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4780                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4781                                  
  4782                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4783                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4784 000017F3 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4785 000017F6 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4786                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4787                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4788                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4789 000017F9 EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4790                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4791                                  
  4792                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4793 000017FB D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4794 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4795                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4796                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4797                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4798 000017FF 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4799 00001801 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4800 00001803 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4801                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4802                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4803                                  		; ds = cs
  4804 00001804 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4805                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4806                                  notsingle:				
  4807 00001808 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4808                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4809                                  					; booted off hard file
  4810 00001809 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4811                                  
  4812                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4813                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4814                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4815                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4816                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4817                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4818                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4819                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4820                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4821                                  
  4822                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4823                                  
  4824 0000180B F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4825 0000180E 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4826 00001810 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4827                                  gothrd:		
  4828                                  		; 07/10/2023			
  4829                                  		;xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4830                                  		;			; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4831                                  		;			; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4832                                  		;			; ch = media byte
  4833                                  
  4834                                  		; 07/10/2023
  4835                                  		; ss = 0, sp = 700h (from MSLOAD)
  4836                                  		;cli
  4837                                  		;mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4838                                  		;mov	sp, 700h
  4839                                  		;sti
  4840                                  
  4841 00001812 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4842 00001813 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4843 00001815 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4844                                  		
  4845                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4846                                  
  4847 00001816 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4848 00001818 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4849 0000181A 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4850 0000181C 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4851 0000181F 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4852                                  
  4853                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4854                                  		; ds = cs
  4855 00001821 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4856 00001825 A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4857                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4858                                  					; get/save model byte
  4859 00001828 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]
  4860 0000182C A2[3F06]                		mov	[secondary_model_byte], al
  4861                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4862                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4863 0000182F EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4864                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4865                                  
  4866                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4867 00001831 BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4868 00001834 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4869                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4870 00001836 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4871 0000183A A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4872                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4873                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4874 0000183D B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4875 0000183F E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.

  5183                                  ; scan the list of drives to determine their type. we have three flavors of

  5187                                  ;   96tpi drives    mark the fact that they have changeline support.
  5188                                  ;   3.5"  drives    mark changeline support and small.

  5191                                  ;

  5193                                  ;   ds:di - points to current bds

  5208                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  5209                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, MSINIT.ASM)
  5210                                  
  5211                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5212                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5213                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5214                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5215                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5216                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5217                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5218                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5254                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives

  5256 000019B8 7276                    		jc	short noparmsfromrom

  5258                                  ; if cmos is bad, it gives es,ax,bx,cx,dh,di=0. cy=0.
  5259                                  ; in this case, we are going to put bogus informations to bds table.
  5260                                  ; we are going to set ch=39,cl=9,dh=1 to avoid divide overflow when
  5261                                  ; they are calculated at the later time. this is just for the diagnostic
  5262                                  ; diskette which need msbio,msdos to boot up before it sets cmos.
  5263                                  ; this should only happen with drive b.
  5264                                  
  5265 000019BA 80FD00                  		cmp	ch, 0		; if ch=0, then	cl,dh=0	too.

  5268                                  		;mov	cl, 9		; let's default to 360k.
  5269                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5270 000019BF B90927                  		mov	cx, 2709h
  5271 000019C2 B601                    		mov	dh, 1

  5274 000019C6 FEC5                    		inc	ch		; make number of cylinders 1-based

  5518                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5519                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5520                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives

  5535                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5536                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table
  5537                                  ;shows the configurations under consideration. they are listed in the order
  5538                                  ;of their current position memory.
  5539                                  ;
  5540                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5541                                  ;
  5542                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5543                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5544                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5545                                  ;use to start with.
  5546                                  ;
  5547                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5548                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5549                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5550                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5551                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5552

  5620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5621                                  
  5622                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5623                                  ;
  5624                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5625                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5626                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5627                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5628                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5629                                  ; off of it.
  5630                                  ;
  5631                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5632                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5633                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5634                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5635                                  ; when to install the hook.
  5636                                  
  5637                                  ;checkcmosclock:
  5638                                  ; 02/10/2022				
  5639                                  checkcompaqbug:
  5640                                  		; 21/12/2022
  5641                                  		; es = 0F000h
  5642                                  		;mov	ax, 0F000h	; point	to ROM BIOS
  5643                                  		;mov	es, ax
  5644                                  
  5645                                  		; 19/10/2022
  5646 00001B50 26813EEAFF434F          		cmp	word [es:0FFEAh], 'CO'
  5647                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEAh, 'OC' ; look for COMPAQ
  5648 00001B57 754B                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5649 00001B59 26813EECFF4D50          		cmp	word [es:0FFECh], 'MP'
  5650                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFECh, 'PM'
  5651 00001B60 7542                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5652 00001B62 26813EEEFF4151          		cmp	word [es:0FFEEh], 'AQ'
  5653                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:0FFEEh, 'QA'
  5654 00001B69 7539                    		jnz	short not_compaq_patch
  5655                                  
  5656                                  ; We're running on a COMPAQ. Now look at the date code.
  5657                                  
  5658 00001B6B 26A1FBFF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFFBh]	; get year
  5659 00001B6F 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5660 00001B71 3D3638                  		cmp	ax, 3836h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5661                                  		;cmp	ax, '86'        ; 3836h
  5662                                  					; is it	86?
  5663 00001B74 772E                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch
  5664 00001B76 7218                    		jb	short do_compaq_patch
  5665 00001B78 26A1F5FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF5h]	; get month
  5666 00001B7C 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5667 00001B7E 3D3830                  		cmp	ax, 3038h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5668                                  		;cmp	ax, '08'        ; 3038h
  5669                                  					; is it	08?
  5670 00001B81 7721                    		ja	short not_compaq_patch

  5672 00001B85 26A1F8FF                		mov	ax, [es:0FFF8h]	; get day
  5673 00001B89 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al
  5674 00001B8B 3D3430                  		cmp	ax, 3034h ; 02/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  5675                                  		;cmp	ax, '04'        ; 3034h
  5676                                  					; is it	04?
  5677 00001B8E 7314                    		jnb	short not_compaq_patch

  5917                                  
  5918                                  ; Following are subroutines to support resident device driver initialization
  5919                                  ;
  5920                                  ;M011 -- note:  deleted setup_bdsms and reset_bdsms here
  5921                                  
  5922                                  ;	M035 -- begin changed section
  5923                                  
  5924                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5925                                  ; module name: remap
  5926                                  ;
  5927                                  ; descriptive name: all the code for himem that could be separated from msbio
  5928                                  ;
  5929                                  ; function:  remap the bds chain to adjusted logical drive numbers (drive
  5930                                  ;	     letters) if more than two diskette drives on the system.
  5931                                  ;
  5932                                  ;     scheme:  if more than 2 diskette drives, first map the bds structure
  5933                                  ;	       as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the drive
  5934                                  ;	       letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5935                                  ;	       drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5936                                  ;	       and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk
  5937                                  ;	       drive to the 3rd and 4th diskette drives.
  5938                                  
  5939                                  ; input:       none
  5940                                  ; exit:	drive letters have been remapped in bds chain
  5941                                  ; exit error:  none
  5942                                  ; called from: msinit
  5943                                  ;
  5944                                  ; notes:  this function  will be called only if more than 2 diskettes are
  5945                                  ;	  found in the system
  5946                                  ;	  this function assumes that there are no more than 26 drives assigned
  5947                                  ;	    this is guaranteed by the code that creates bdss for partitions
  5948                                  ;	  this function assumes that the first entries in the chain are
  5949                                  ;	   floppy drives, and all the rest are hard drives
  5950                                  ;	  will alter the boot drive if necessary to reflect remapping
  5951                                  ;
  5952                                  ;******************************************************************************
  5953                                  
  5954                                  ; 17/10/2022
  5955                                  ; 02/10/2022
  5956                                  
  5957                                  remap:		; proc near		
  5958 00001C66 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; get first bds
  5959                                  
  5960                                  ; search for 1st fixed disk physical drive num
  5961                                  
  5962                                  drive_loop:				
  5963 00001C6B 807D0480                		cmp	byte [di+4], 80h ; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  5964                                  					; first	hard disk??
  5965 00001C6F 7409                    		jz	short fdrv_found ; yes,	continue
  5966 00001C71 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5967                                  					; get next bds,	assume segment
  5968 00001C73 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, -1		; last bds?
  5969 00001C76 75F3                    		jnz	short drive_loop ; loop	if not
  5970 00001C78 EB4F                    		jmp	short rmap_exit	; yes, no hard drive on	system
  5971                                  
  5972                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5973                                  ;first disk drive bds, now change the logical drive num to 2 and the subsequent
  5974                                  ;logical drive nums to 3, 4, 5 etc.
  5975                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5976                                  
  5977                                  fdrv_found:				
  5978 00001C7A B002                    		mov	al, 2		; start	with logical drv num=2
  5979                                  fdrv_loop:				
  5980 00001C7C 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  5981                                  					; found	??
  5982 00001C7F 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5983                                  					; ds:di--> next	bds
  5984                                  		;inc	al		; set num for next drive
  5985                                  		; 18/12/2022
  5986 00001C81 40                      		inc	ax
  5987 00001C82 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; last hard drive ??
  5988 00001C85 75F5                    		jnz	short fdrv_loop	; no - assign more disk	drives
  5989                                  
  5990                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5991                                  ; now, rescan and find bds of 3rd floppy drive and assign next drive letter
  5992                                  ; in al to 3rd. if the current drive letter is past z, then do not allocate
  5993                                  ; any more.
  5994                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5995                                  
  5996 00001C87 2E8B3E[1901]            		mov	di, [cs:start_bds] ; [start_bds]
  5997                                  					; get first bds
  5998 00001C8C 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  5999                                  					; ds:di-->bds2
  6000 00001C8E 2E8A26[2501]            		mov	ah, [cs:dsktnum] ; get number of floppies to remap
  6001 00001C93 80EC02                  		sub	ah, 2		; adjust for a:	& b:
  6002                                  remap_loop1:				
  6003 00001C96 8B3D                    		mov	di, [di]	; [di+BDS.link]
  6004                                  					; set new num to next floppy
  6005 00001C98 884505                  		mov	[di+5],	al	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6006 00001C9B FEC0                    		inc	al		; new number for next floppy
  6007 00001C9D FECC                    		dec	ah		; count	down extra floppies
  6008 00001C9F 75F5                    		jnz	short remap_loop1
  6009                                  
  6010                                  ; now we've got to adjust the boot drive if we reassigned it
  6011                                  
  6012 00001CA1 2EA0[CA16]              		mov	al, [cs:drvfat]
  6013 00001CA5 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; is it	a: or b: ?
  6014 00001CA7 7220                    		jb	short rmap_exit
  6015 00001CA9 2E2A06[2501]            		sub	al, [cs:dsktnum] ; is it one of the other floppies?
  6016 00001CAE 7204                    		jb	short remap_boot_flop ;	brif so
  6017                                  
  6018                                  ; we've got to remap the boot hard drive
  6019                                  ; subtract the number of EXTRA floppies from it
  6020                                  
  6021 00001CB0 0402                    		add	al, 2		; bootdrv -= (dsktnum-2)
  6022 00001CB2 EB05                    		jmp	short remap_change_boot_drv
  6023                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6024                                  
  6025                                  ; we've got to remap the boot floppy.
  6026                                  ; add the number of hard drive partitions to it
  6027                                  
  6028                                  remap_boot_flop:			
  6029 00001CB4 2E0206[7500]            		add	al, [cs:drvmax]	; bootdrv += (drvmax-dsktnum)
  6030                                  remap_change_boot_drv:			
  6031 00001CB9 2EA2[CA16]              		mov	[cs:drvfat], al ; alter msdos.sys load drive
  6032 00001CBD FEC0                    		inc	al
  6033 00001CBF 1E                      		push	ds
  6034 00001CC0 BF5704                  		mov	di, SYSINITSEG	; 46Dh
  6035                                  		;mov	di, 46Dh	; SYSINIT segment
  6036 00001CC3 8EDF                    		mov	ds, di
  6037 00001CC5 A2[9602]                		mov	[DEFAULTDRIVE], al
  6038                                  		;mov	ds:296h, al	; [SYSINIT+DEFAULT_DRIVE]
  6039                                  					; pass it to sysinit as	well
  6040 00001CC8 1F                      		pop	ds
  6041                                  rmap_exit:				
  6042 00001CC9 C3                      		retn
  6043                                  
  6044                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6045                                  
  6046                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6047                                  ; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 -actual-)
  6048                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 -draft-)
  6049                                  ; 02/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3)	
  6050                                  ; 19/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
  6051                                  ;**************************************************
  6052                                  ; getboot - get the boot sector for a hard disk
  6053                                  ;
  6054                                  ; Reads the boot sector from a specified drive into
  6055                                  ; a buffer at the top of memory.
  6056                                  ;
  6057                                  ; dl = int13 drive number to read boot sector for
  6058                                  ;**************************************************
  6059                                  
  6060                                  ; 17/10/2022
  6061                                  bootbias equ 200h
  6062                                  
  6063                                  getboot:	; proc near		
  6064                                  		
  6065                                  		; 08/04/2018
  6066                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 (IBMBIO.COM, IBMDOS 2.1)
  6067                                  		; 28/03/2018 - MSDOS 6.0 - MSINIT.ASM, 1991
  6068                                  		; 02/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6069                                  		;	      (disassembled IO.SYS code of MSDOS 5.0)
  6070                                  
  6071 00001CCA 2EA1[D516]              		mov	ax, [cs:init_bootseg] ; 17/10/2022
  6072 00001CCE 8EC0                    		mov	es, ax
  6073                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6074 00001CD0 BB0002                  		mov	bx, bootbias ; 200h
  6075                                  		;mov	bx, 200h	; bootbias
  6076                                  					; load BX, ES:BX is where sector goes
  6077 00001CD3 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6078 00001CD6 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
  6079 00001CD8 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
  6080 00001CDB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6081                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6082                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6083                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6084 00001CDD 7209                    		jb	short erret
  6085                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6086 00001CDF 26813EFE0355AA          		cmp	word [es:bootbias+1FEh], 0AA55h
  6087                                  		;cmp	word ptr es:3FEh, 0AA55h ; [es:bootbias+1FEh]
  6088                                  					; Dave Litton magic word?
  6089 00001CE6 7401                    		jz	short norm_ret	; yes
  6090                                  erret:					
  6091 00001CE8 F9                      		stc
  6092                                  norm_ret:				
  6093 00001CE9 C3                      		retn
  6094                                  
  6095                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  6096                                  
  6097                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 
  6098                                  
  6099                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6100                                  ;   sethard - generate bpb for a variable sized hard file. ibm has a
  6101                                  ;   partitioned hard file; we must read physical sector 0 to determine where
  6102                                  ;   our own logical sectors start. we also read in our boot sector to
  6103                                  ;   determine version number
  6104                                  ;
  6105                                  ;   inputs:	dl is rom drive number (80...)
  6106                                  ;		bh is partition number (0....) 
  6107                                  ;		ds:di points to bds
  6108                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear -> bpb is filled in
  6109                                  ;		carry set   -> bpb is left uninitialized due to error
  6110                                  ;	trashes (at least) si, cx
  6111                                  ;	MUST PRESERVE ES:!!!!
  6112                                  ;***************************************************************************
  6113                                  
  6114                                  sethard:	; proc near		
  6115 00001CEA 57                      		push	di
  6116 00001CEB 53                      		push	bx
  6117 00001CEC 1E                      		push	ds
  6118 00001CED 06                      		push	es
  6119 00001CEE 885D05                  		mov	[di+5],	bl	; [di+BDS.drivelet]
  6120 00001CF1 885504                  		mov	[di+4],	dl	; [di+BDS.drivenum]
  6121 00001CF4 804D2301                		or	byte [di+23h], 1 ; [di+BDS.flags]
  6122                                  					; fnon_removable
  6123 00001CF8 C6452205                		mov	byte [di+22h], 5 ; [di+BDS.formfactor]
  6124                                  					; ffHardFile
  6125 00001CFC C606[D216]00            		mov	byte [fbigfat], 0 ; assume 12 bit FAT
  6126 00001D01 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; partition number
  6127 00001D03 52                      		push	dx
  6128 00001D04 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  6129 00001D06 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  6130                                  					; DL = drive number
  6131                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  6132                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  6133                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  6134 00001D08 FEC6                    		inc	dh
  6135 00001D0A 887515                  		mov	[di+15h], dh	; [di+BDS.heads] ; get number of heads
  6136 00001D0D 5A                      		pop	dx
  6137 00001D0E 7263                    		jb	short setret	; error	if no hard disk
  6138 00001D10 80E13F                  		and	cl, 3Fh
  6139 00001D13 884D13                  		mov	[di+13h], cl	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6140 00001D16 52                      		push	dx		; save partition number
  6141 00001D17 E8B0FF                  		call	getboot
  6142 00001D1A 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore partition number
  6143 00001D1B 7256                    		jb	short setret
  6144 00001D1D BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6145                                  
  6146                                  ; The first 'active' partition is 00, the second is 01....
  6147                                  ;   then the remainder of the 'primary' but non-active partitions
  6148                                  
  6149                                  act_part:				
  6150 00001D20 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h ; is the partition active?
  6151 00001D25 7418                    		jz	short no_act	; no
  6152 00001D27 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; reject if partitiontype != 1, 4 or 6
  6153 00001D2B 740C                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6154 00001D2D 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6155 00001D31 7406                    		jz	short got_good_act
  6156 00001D33 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6157 00001D37 7506                    		jnz	short no_act
  6158                                  got_good_act:				
  6159 00001D39 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition #?
  6160 00001D3B 743A                    		jz	short set2	; WE GOT THE ONE WANTED!!
  6161 00001D3D FECE                    		dec	dh		; count	down
  6162                                  no_act:					
  6163 00001D3F 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6164 00001D42 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6165                                  					; last entry done?
  6166 00001D46 75D8                    		jnz	short act_part	; no, process next entry
  6167 00001D48 BBC203                  		mov	bx, 3C2h	; 1C2h+bootbias
  6168                                  					; restore original value of bx
  6169                                  
  6170                                  ; Now scan the non-active partitions
  6171                                  
  6172                                  get_primary:				
  6173 00001D4B 26F647FC80              		test	byte [es:bx-4], 80h
  6174 00001D50 7518                    		jnz	short not_prim	; we've already scanned
  6175                                  					; the ACTIVE ones
  6176 00001D52 26803F01                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 1 ; see if partitiontype == 1, 4 or 6
  6177 00001D56 740C                    		jz	short got_prim
  6178 00001D58 26803F04                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 4
  6179 00001D5C 7406                    		jz	short got_prim
  6180 00001D5E 26803F06                		cmp	byte [es:bx], 6
  6181 00001D62 7506                    		jnz	short not_prim
  6182                                  got_prim:				
  6183 00001D64 08F6                    		or	dh, dh		; is this our target partition?
  6184 00001D66 740F                    		jz	short set2
  6185 00001D68 FECE                    		dec	dh
  6186                                  not_prim:				
  6187 00001D6A 83C310                  		add	bx, 16
  6188 00001D6D 81FB0204                		cmp	bx, 402h	; 202h+bootbias
  6189 00001D71 75D8                    		jnz	short get_primary ; loop till we've gone through table
  6190                                  setret:					
  6191 00001D73 F9                      		stc			; error	return
  6192 00001D74 E9DC02                  		jmp	ret_hard_err
  6193                                  
  6194                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6195                                  
  6196                                  ;  until we get the real logical boot record and get the bpb,
  6197                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be used instead of BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS
  6198                                  ;  for the convenience of the computation.
  6199                                  ;
  6200                                  ;  at the end of this procedure, if a bpb information is gotten from
  6201                                  ;  the valid boot record, then we are going to use those bpb information
  6202                                  ;  without change.
  6203                                  ;
  6204                                  ;  otherwise, if (hidden sectors + total sectors) <= a word, then we will move
  6205                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS (low) to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and zero out
  6206                                  ;  BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS entry to make it a conventional bpb format.
  6207                                  
  6208                                  set2:					
  6209 00001D77 2E8816[D716]            		mov	[cs:rom_drv_num], dl
  6210                                  			; save the rom bios drive number we are handling now.
  6211 00001D7C 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]	; hidden sectors (start	sector)
  6212 00001D80 268B5706                		mov	dx, [es:bx+6]
  6213                                  
  6214                                  ; decrement the sector count by 1 to make it zero based. exactly 64k
  6215                                  ; sectors should be allowed	
  6216                                  
  6217 00001D84 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  6218 00001D87 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  6219 00001D8A 26034708                		add	ax, [es:bx+8]	; sectors in partition
  6220 00001D8E 2613570A                		adc	dx, [es:bx+10]
  6221 00001D92 7305                    		jnb	short okdrive
  6222 00001D94 800E[D216]80            		or	byte [fbigfat], 80h ; ftoobig
  6223                                  okdrive:				
  6224 00001D99 268B4704                		mov	ax, [es:bx+4]
  6225 00001D9D 894517                  		mov	[di+17h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6226                                  					; BPB_HIDDENSECTORS = p->partitionbegin
  6227 00001DA0 268B4706                		mov	ax, [es:bx+6]
  6228 00001DA4 894519                  		mov	[di+19h], ax	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6229 00001DA7 268B570A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+10]	; # of sectors (high)
  6230 00001DAB 268B4708                		mov	ax, [es:bx+8]	; # of sectors (low)
  6231 00001DAF 89551D                  		mov	[di+1Dh], dx	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
  6232 00001DB2 89451B                  		mov	[di+1Bh], ax	; [di+BDS.totalsecs32]
  6233                                  					; bpb->maxsec =	p->partitionlength
  6234 00001DB5 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  6235 00001DB8 7705                    		ja	short okdrive_1
  6236 00001DBA 83F840                  		cmp	ax, 64		; if (p->partitionlength < 64)
  6237 00001DBD 72B4                    		jb	short setret	; return -1;
  6238                                  okdrive_1:				
  6239 00001DBF 8B5519                  		mov	dx, [di+19h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
  6240 00001DC2 8B4517                  		mov	ax, [di+17h]	; [di+BDS.hiddensecs]
  6241 00001DC5 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; boot sector number - for mini	disk
  6242                                  					; usually equal	to the # of sec/trk.
  6243 00001DC7 8A5D13                  		mov	bl, [di+13h]	; [di+BDS.secpertrack]
  6244 00001DCA 50                      		push	ax
  6245 00001DCB 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
  6246 00001DCD 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6247 00001DCF F7F3                    		div	bx		; (sectors)dx:ax / (BDS.secpertrack)bx =
  6248                                  					; (track)temp_h:ax + (sector)dx
  6249                                  		; 17/10/2022
  6250 00001DD1 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6251 00001DD5 58                      		pop	ax
  6252 00001DD6 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6253 00001DD8 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl
  6254 00001DDA FEC1                    		inc	cl
  6255 00001DDC 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  6256 00001DDE 8A5D15                  		mov	bl, [di+15h]	; [di+BDS.heads]
  6257 00001DE1 50                      		push	ax
  6258 00001DE2 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  6259 00001DE4 2EA1[2905]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_h]
  6260 00001DE8 F7F3                    		div	bx
  6261 00001DEA 2EA3[2905]              		mov	[cs:temp_h], ax
  6262 00001DEE 58                      		pop	ax
  6263 00001DEF F7F3                    		div	bx		;  dl is head, ax is cylinder
  6264 00001DF1 2E833E[2905]00          		cmp	word [cs:temp_h], 0
  6265 00001DF7 777C                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6266 00001DF9 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024
  6267 00001DFC 7777                    		ja	short setret_brdg ; exceeds the	limit of int 13h
  6268                                  			; Retro DOS v3.2 note by Erdogan Tan - 28/07/2019
  6269                                  			; **MSDOS code accepts if ax = 1024 but it is nonsense here
  6270                                  			; ('ja' must be 'jnb')
  6271                                  okdrive_2:
  6272                                   		; 28/07/2019
  6273                                  ; dl is head.
  6274                                  ; ax is cylinder
  6275                                  ; cl is sector number (assume less than 2**6 = 64 for int 13h)
  6276                                  
  6277                                  ;*** for mini disks ***
  6278                                  
  6279 00001DFE 837D4701                		cmp	word [di+47h], 1 ; [di+BDS.bdsm_ismini]
  6280                                  					; check	for mini disk
  6281 00001E02 7503                    		jnz	short oknotmini	; not mini disk.
  6282 00001E04 034549                  		add	ax, [di+49h]	; [di+BDS.bdsm_hidden_trks]
  6283                                  					; set the physical track number
  6284                                  oknotmini:
  6285                                  ;*** end of added logic for mini disk
  6286                                  				
  6287 00001E07 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; move high two	bits of	cyl to high
  6288 00001E09 D0CC                    		ror	ah, 1		; two bits of upper byte
  6289 00001E0B 80E4C0                  		and	ah, 0C0h	; turn off remainder of	bits
  6290 00001E0E 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; move two bits	to correct spot
  6291 00001E10 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch is	cylinder (low 8	bits)
  6292                                  					; cl is	sector + 2 high	bits of	cylinder
  6293 00001E12 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl		; dh is	head
  6294 00001E14 2E8A16[D716]            		mov	dl, [cs:rom_drv_num] ; dl is drive number
  6295                                  
  6296                                  ; cl is sector + 2 high bits of cylinder
  6297                                  ; ch is low 8 bits of cylinder
  6298                                  ; dh is head
  6299                                  ; dl is drive
  6300                                  
  6301                                  ; for convenience, we are going to read the logical boot sector
  6302                                  ; into cs:disksector area.
  6303                                  
  6304                                  ; read in boot sector using bios disk interrupt. the buffer where it
  6305                                  ; is to be read in is cs:disksector.
  6306                                  
  6307 00001E19 0E                      		push	cs
  6308 00001E1A 07                      		pop	es
  6309 00001E1B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; for convenience,
  6310                                  					; we are going to read the logical boot	sector
  6311                                  					; into cs:disksector area.
  6312 00001E1E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
  6313 00001E21 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
  6314                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
  6315                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
  6316                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
  6317                                  
  6318                                  ; cs:disksec contains the boot sector. in theory, (ha ha) the bpb in this thing
  6319                                  ; is correct. we can, therefore, suck out all the relevant statistics on the
  6320                                  ; media if we recognize the version number.
  6321                                  
  6322 00001E23 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
  6323 00001E26 53                      		push	bx
  6324 00001E27 50                      		push	ax
  6325 00001E28 2E803FE9                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0E9h ; is it a near jump?
  6326 00001E2C 740D                    		jz	short check_1_ok ; yes
  6327 00001E2E 2E803FEB                		cmp	byte [cs:bx], 0EBh ; is it a short jump?
  6328 00001E32 7529                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no
  6329 00001E34 2E807F0290              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+2], 90h ; yes, is the next one a nop?
  6330 00001E39 7522                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record
  6331                                  check_1_ok:
  6332                                  		; 14/08/2023			
  6333 00001E3B BB[5901]                		mov	bx, disksector+11 ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB				
  6334                                  		;mov	bx, 159h	; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB
  6335                                  					; point	to the bpb in the boot record
  6336 00001E3E 2E8A470A                		mov	al, [cs:bx+10]	; [bx+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  6337                                  					; get the mediadescriptor byte
  6338 00001E42 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h	; mask off low nibble
  6339 00001E44 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; is high nibble = 0Fh?
  6340 00001E46 7515                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; no,	invalid	boot record
  6341 00001E48 2E813F0002              		cmp	word [cs:bx], 512 ; [bx+EBPB.BYTESPERSECTOR]
  6342 00001E4D 750E                    		jnz	short invalid_boot_record ; invalidate non 512 byte sectors
  6343                                  
  6344                                  check2_ok:				; yes, mediadescriptor ok.
  6345 00001E4F 2E8A4702                		mov	al, [cs:bx+2]	; now make sure	that
  6346                                  					; the sectorspercluster	is
  6347                                  					; a power of 2
  6348                                  					;
  6349                                  					; [bx+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  6350                                  					; get the sectorspercluster
  6351 00001E53 08C0                    		or	al, al		; is it	zero?
  6352 00001E55 7406                    		jz	short invalid_boot_record ; yes, invalid boot record
  6353                                  
  6354                                  ck_power_of_two:			
  6355 00001E57 D0E8                    		shr	al, 1		; shift	until first bit	emerges
  6356 00001E59 73FC                    		jnb	short ck_power_of_two
  6357 00001E5B 7405                    		jz	short valid_boot_record
  6358                                  
  6359                                  invalid_boot_record:			
  6360 00001E5D 58                      		pop	ax
  6361 00001E5E 5B                      		pop	bx
  6362 00001E5F E93301                  		jmp	unknown		; jump to invalid boot record
  6363                                  					; unformatted or illegal media.
  6364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6365                                  
  6366                                  valid_boot_record:			
  6367 00001E62 58                      		pop	ax
  6368 00001E63 5B                      		pop	bx
  6369                                  
  6370                                  ; Signature found. Now check version.
  6371                                  
  6372 00001E64 2E817F08322E            		cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '2.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6373                                  		;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E32h ; '2.'
  6374 00001E6A 750F                    		jnz	short try5
  6375 00001E6C 2E807F0A30              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+0Ah], '0' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6376                                  		;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 30h ; '0'
  6377 00001E71 7508                    		jnz	short try5
  6378 00001E73 EB2F                    		jmp	short copybpb
  6379                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6380                                  
  6381                                  setret_brdg:				
  6382 00001E75 E9FBFE                  		jmp	setret
  6383                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6384                                  
  6385                                  unknown3_0_j:				
  6386 00001E78 E91E01                  		jmp	unknown3_0	; legally formatted media,
  6387                                  					; although, content might be bad.
  6388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6389                                  
  6390                                  try5:					
  6391 00001E7B E8DA01                  		call	cover_fdisk_bug
  6392                                  
  6393                                  ; see if it is an os2 signature
  6394                                  
  6395 00001E7E 2E817F08302E            		cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '0.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6396                                  		;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E30h ; '0.'
  6397 00001E84 750D                    		jnz	short no_os2
  6398 00001E86 2E8A4707                		mov	al, [cs:bx+7]	; 17/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6399 00001E8A 2C31                    		sub	al, '1'
  6400                                  		;sub	al, 31h		; '1'
  6401 00001E8C 24FE                    		and	al, 0FEh
  6402 00001E8E 7414                    		jz	short copybpb	; accept either	'1' or '2'
  6403 00001E90 E90201                  		jmp	unknown
  6404                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6405                                  
  6406                                  ; no os2 signature, this is to check for real dos versions
  6407                                  
  6408                                  no_os2:					
  6409 00001E93 2E817F08332E            		cmp	word [cs:bx+8], '3.' ; 03/10/2022 (NASM syntax)
  6410                                  		;cmp	word ptr cs:[bx+8], 2E33h ; '3.'
  6411 00001E99 72DD                    		jb	short unknown3_0_j ; must be 2.1 boot record.
  6412                                  					; do not trust it, but still legal.
  6413 00001E9B 7507                    		jnz	short copybpb	; honor	os2 boot record
  6414                                  					; or dos 4.0 version
  6415 00001E9D 2E807F0A31              		cmp	byte [cs:bx+10], '1'
  6416                                  		;cmp	byte ptr cs:[bx+0Ah], 31h ; '1'
  6417 00001EA2 72D4                    		jb	short unknown3_0_j ; if version >=	3.1, then o.k.
  6418                                  copybpb:
  6419                                  
  6420                                  ; 03/10/2022
  6421                                  
  6422                                  ; we have a valid boot sector. use the bpb in it to build the
  6423                                  ; bpb in bios. it is assumed that only
  6424                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER
  6425                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_ROOTENTRIES, and
  6426                                  ;	BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERFAT
  6427                                  ; need to be set (all other values in already). fbigfat is also set.
  6428                                  
  6429                                  ; if it is non fat based system, then just copy the bpb from the boot sector
  6430                                  ; into the bpb in bds table, and also set the boot serial number, volume id,
  6431                                  ; and system id according to the boot record.
  6432                                  ; for the non_fat system, don't need to set the other value. so just do goodret.
  6433                                  
  6434                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6435                                  		; (number of FATs optimization)
  6436 00001EA4 BE[5901]                		mov	si, disksector+11 ; disksector+0Bh
  6437                                  		;mov	cl, [cs:disksector+10h] ; Number of FATs (may be 2 or 1)
  6438 00001EA7 2E8A4C05                		mov	cl, [cs:si+05h]
  6439                                  		
  6440 00001EAB 2E807C1B29              		cmp	byte [cs:si+1Bh], 29h ; 10/12/2022	
  6441                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:disksector+26h], 29h ; 17/10/2022
  6442                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
  6443                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  6444 00001EB0 754E                    		jnz	short copybpb_fat ; conventional fat system
  6445                                  
  6446                                  		; 03/10/2022
  6447                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0 modification note:
  6448                                  		; Regarding 'fat_big_small' part of this (MSDOS 6.0) code
  6449                                  		;	     number of FATs must be 2 ; =*?=
  6450                                  		; (Otherwise, '# of data sectors' would be calculated as wrong!!!)
  6451                                  		;
  6452                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.NUMBEROFFATS], 2 ; =*?=
  6453                                  
  6454                                  		; 10/12/2022
  6455                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:disksector+10h], 0
  6456                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.NUMBEROFFATS]
  6457                                  		;jnz	short copybpb_fat ; a fat system.

  6542                                  ; ****** cas ---
  6543                                  ; IBM DOS 3.30 doesn't seem to mind that the TOTAL_SECTORS and
  6544                                  ; BIG_TOTAL_SECTORS field in the boot sector are 0000. This
  6545                                  ; happens with some frequency -- perhaps through some OS/2 setup
  6546                                  ; program. We haven't actually been COPYING the TOTAL_SECTORS
  6547                                  ; from the boot sector into the DPB anyway, we've just been using

  6549                                  ; we'll go ahead and copy it into the DPB, except in the case
  6550                                  ; that it equals zero, in which case we just use the values in

  6562                                  copybpb_fat:

  6726                                  					; cl = log base	2 of ch

  6739                                  		;test	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  6740                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  6741 00001FD4 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  6742                                  
  6743                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is gauranteed
  6744                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  6745                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  6746                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  6747                                  
  6748 00001FD6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; (12 bit fat)
  6749 00001FD8 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  6750 00001FDA 4B                      		dec	bx
  6751 00001FDB 01C3                    		add	bx, ax		; dx=0
  6752 00001FDD D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  6753 00001FDF 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus

  6755 00001FE3 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
  6756 00001FE5 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1

  6758 00001FE9 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  6759 00001FED D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)

  6761                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  6762 00001FF2 EB39                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
