  8872 00000350 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
  8873 00000352 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8874 00000354 F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
  8875 00000357 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
  8876                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8877                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
  8878                                  		;clc
  8879 00000359 C3                      		retn
  8880                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8881                                  
  8882                                  ;************************************************************************
  8883                                  ;*									*
  8884                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
  8885                                  ;*									*
  8886                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
  8887                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8888                                  ;*									*
  8889                                  ;************************************************************************
  8890                                  
  8891                                  auxstat:				
  8892 0000035A B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
  8893                                  
  8894                                  		; fall into auxop
  8895                                  
  8896                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8897                                  
  8898                                  ;************************************************************************
  8899                                  ;*									*
  8900                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
  8901                                  ;*									*
  8902                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
  8903                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
  8904                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
  8905                                  ;*									*
  8906                                  ;************************************************************************
  8907                                  
  8908                                  auxop:		; proc near		
  8909 0000035C 8B16[2100]              		mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
  8910                                  					; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
  8911                                  					; get port number
  8912 00000360 CD14                    		int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
  8913                                  					; DX = port number (0-3)
  8914                                  					; Return: AX = port status code
  8915 00000362 C3                      		retn
  8916                                  
  8917                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8918                                  
  8919                                  ;************************************************************************
  8920                                  ;*									*
  8921                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
  8922                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
  8923                                  ;*									*
  8924                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
  8925                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
  8926                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
  8927                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
  8928                                  ;*									*
  8929                                  ;************************************************************************
  8930                                  
  8931                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
  8932 00000363 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
  8933 00000366 C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
  8934                                  					; zero out buffer
  8935                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8936                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8937                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
  8938 00000369 C3                      		retn
  8939                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8940                                  
  8941                                  ;************************************************************************
  8942                                  ;*									*
  8943                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
  8944                                  ;*									*
  8945                                  ;************************************************************************
  8946                                  
  8947                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
  8948                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
  8949 0000036A E3AD                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
  8950                                  aux_loop:				
  8951 0000036C 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
  8952                                  					; move di pointer to next character
  8953 0000036F 47                      		inc	di
  8954 00000370 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
  8955 00000372 E8E7FF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
  8956 00000375 F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
  8957 00000378 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
  8958 0000037A B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
  8959 0000037C E958FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
  8960                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8961                                  
  8962                                  awok:					
  8963 0000037F E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
  8964                                  					; still	more character to print
  8965                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
  8966                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8967                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
  8968 00000381 C3                      		retn
  8969                                  
  8970                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8971                                  
  8972                                  ;************************************************************************
  8973                                  ;*									*
  8974                                  ;*	getbx - return bx -> single byte input buffer for		*
  8975                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
  8976                                  ;*									*
  8977                                  ;************************************************************************
  8978                                  
  8979                                  getbx:	
  8980 00000382 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
  8981                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
  8982                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  8983 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  8984                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8985                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  8986 0000038A C3                      		retn
  8987                                  
  8988                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8989                                  
  8990                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8991                                  
  8992                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  8993                                  ;								:
  8994                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  8995                                  ;								:
  8996                                  ;								:
  8997                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  8998                                  ;								:
  8999                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9000                                  ;								:
  9001                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9002                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9003                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9004                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9005                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9006                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9007                                  ;								:
  9008                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9009                                  ;								:
  9010                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9011                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9012                                  ;								:
  9013                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9014                                  
  9015                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9016                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9017                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9018                                  
  9019                                  ;19/07/2019
  9020                                  ;09/03/2019
  9021                                  
  9022                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9023                                  
  9024                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9025                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9026                                  
  9027 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9028 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9029 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9030 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9031 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9032 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9033 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9034 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9035 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9036 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9037 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9038 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9039 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9040 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9041 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9042                                  
  9043                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9044                                  
  9045 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9046 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9047 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9048 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9049 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9050 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9051 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9052 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9053 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9054 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9055 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9056 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9057 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9058 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9059 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9060 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9061 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9062 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9063 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9064 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9065                                  
  9066                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9067                                  
  9068                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9069                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9070                                  
  9071                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9072                                  ;
  9073                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9074                                  ;
  9075                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9076                                  ;
  9077                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9078                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9079                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9080                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9081                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9082                                  ;
  9083                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9084                                  ;
  9085                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9086                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9087                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9088                                  ;
  9089                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9090                                  
  9091                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9092 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9093 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9094                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9095 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9096                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9097 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9098 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9099                                  					; get binary hours
  9100                                  					; convert to bcd
  9101 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9102                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9103 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9104 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9105 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9106                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9107 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9108 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9109 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9110                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9111 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9112 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9113 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9114 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9115 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9116                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9117                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9118                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9119 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9120                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9121 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9122 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9123                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9124 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9125                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9126                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9127                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9128 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9129 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9130 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9131                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9132                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9133                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9134 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9135 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9136                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9137 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9138 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9139 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9140                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9141                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9142 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9143 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9144 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9145                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9146                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9147                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9148 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9149                                  no_cmos_2:
  9150                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9151                                  		; cf=0				
  9152                                  		;clc
  9153 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9154                                  
  9155                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9156                                  
  9157                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9158                                  
  9159                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9160                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9161                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9162                                  ;
  9163                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9164                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9165                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9166                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9167                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9168                                  ;
  9169                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9170                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9171                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9172                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9173                                  
  9174                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9175 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9176 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9177                                  
  9178                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9179                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9180                                  ;
  9181                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9182                                  ;	       ----------------
  9183                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9184                                  ;
  9185                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9186                                  ;
  9187                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9188                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9189                                  ;		1,193,180
  9190                                  ;
  9191                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9192                                  ;
  9193                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9194                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9195                                  ;		59,659
  9196                                  ;
  9197                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9198                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9199                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9200                                  ;
  9201                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9202                                  ; multiply by 5
  9203                                  
  9204 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9205 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9206                                  					; multiply by 5
  9207 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9208 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9209 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9210 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9211 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9212 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9213 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9214                                  
  9215                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9216                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9217                                  
  9218 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9219 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9220                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9221 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9222 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9223 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9224                                  
  9225                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9226                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9227                                  
  9228 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9229 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9230                                  
  9231                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9232                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9233                                  
  9234 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9235 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9236 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9237 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9238                                  noadj:					
  9239 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9240 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9241                                  
  9242                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9243                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9244                                  
  9245 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9246 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9247 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9248 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9249 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9250 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9251 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9252 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9253                                  
  9254                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9255                                  
  9256 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9257 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9258 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9259 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9260 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9261 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9262 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9263 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9264 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9265                                  
  9266                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9267                                  
  9268                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9269                                  
  9270                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9271                                  ;
  9272                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9273                                  ;
  9274                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9275                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9276                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9277                                  ;
  9278                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9279                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9280                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9281                                  ;			else
  9282                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9283                                  ;		}
  9284                                  ;
  9285                                  ; USES : AX
  9286                                  ;
  9287                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9288                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9289                                  ;
  9290                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9291                                  
  9292                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9293                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9294 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9295 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9296                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9297                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9298                                  					; midnight
  9299                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9300 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9301 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9302 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9303                                  					; and not flag
  9304 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9305 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9306                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9307                                  
  9308                                  inc_case:				
  9309 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9310 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9311 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9312                                  no_rollover:				
  9313 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9314                                  
  9315                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9316                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9317                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9318                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9319                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9320                                  
  9321                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9322                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9323                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9324                                  
  9325                                  ;error_unknown_media equ	7	; for use in BUILD BPB call
  9326                                  
  9327                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE
  9328                                  ;.SECSIZE:	resw 1
  9329                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1
  9330                                  ;.RESNUM:	resw 1
  9331                                  ;.FATNUM:	resb 1
  9332                                  ;.DIRNUM:	resw 1
  9333                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  9334                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1
  9335                                  ;.FATSIZE:	resw 1
  9336                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1
  9337                                  ;.HLIM:		resw 1
  9338                                  ;.HIDDEN:	resw 1
  9339                                  ;.size:
  9340                                  ;endstruc
  9341                                  
  9342                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9343                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9344                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9345                                  
  9346                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9347                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9348                                  
  9349                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9350                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9351                                  
  9352                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9353                                  
  9354                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9355                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9356                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9357                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9358                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9359                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9360                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9361                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9362                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9363                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9364                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9365                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9366                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9367                                  
  9368                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9369                                  
  9370                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9371                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9372                                  ;
  9373                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9374                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9375                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9376                                  ;   else
  9377                                  ;	set slow = value
  9378                                  ;   ...
  9379                                  ;*********************************************
  9380                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9381                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9382                                  ;*	 use slow
  9383                                  ;*   else
  9384                                  ;*	 use fast
  9385                                  ;*********************************************
  9386                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9387                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9388                                  ;	use slow
  9389                                  ;   else
  9390                                  ;	use fast
  9391                                  ;   ...
  9392                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9393                                  ;
  9394                                  ;

  9396                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9397                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9398                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9399                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9400                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.

  9480                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9481                                  
  9482                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9483                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9484                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9485                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9486                                  ;
  9487                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9488                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9489                                  
  9490                                  SetDrive:	
  9491                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9492 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9493                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9494 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9495 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9496 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9497 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9498 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9499 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9500                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9501 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9502                                  
  9503                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9504                                  
  9505                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9506                                  
  9507                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9508                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9509                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9510                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9511                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9512                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9513                                  
  9514                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9515 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9516 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9517 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9518                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9519 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9520                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9521 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9522                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9523                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9524 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9525                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9526 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9527                                  					; fnon_removable
  9528 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9529 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9530 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9531                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9532                                  
  9533                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9534                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9535 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9536 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9537                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9538 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9539                                  
  9540                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9541                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9542                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9543                                  
  9544 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9545 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9546 00000512 E89F12                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9547 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9548 00000517 E8F713                  		call	haschange
  9549 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9550                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9551                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9552                                  			
  9553 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9554 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9555 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9556                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9557 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9558 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9559 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done
  9560                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9561                                  
  9562                                  Media_Unk:

  9564                                  
  9565                                  		; SI now contains the correct value for media change.
  9566                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9567                                  Media_Done:	
  9568                                  		; 19/10/2022			
  9569 0000052E 06                      		push	es
  9570 0000052F C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  9571 00000533 2689770E                		mov	[es:bx+0Eh], si	; [es:bx+trans]
  9572 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9573 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9574 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9575 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9576 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9577 00000543 E85713                  		call	media_set_vid
  9578                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:			
  9579 00000546 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9580                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
  9581                                  ret_carry_clear:			
  9582 0000054B F8                      		clc			; volidok
  9583 0000054C C3                      		retn
  9584                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9585                                  
  9586                                  err_exitj:				
  9587 0000054D E88106                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9588                                  ret81:					
  9589 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9590 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9591                                  
  9592                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9593                                  
  9594                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9595                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9596                                  ; drive.
  9597                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9598                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9599                                  ; returns in si:
  9600                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9601                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9602                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9603                                  ;
  9604                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9605                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9606                                  
  9607                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9608                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9609 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9610 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9611 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9612                                  					; get stored time
  9613 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9614 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9615 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9616 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9617 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9618 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9619 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9620 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9621                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9622 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9623 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9624 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9626                                  
  9627                                  timepassed:				
  9628 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9629                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9630 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9631                                  
  9632                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9633                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9634 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9635                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9636 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9637                                  
  9638                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9639                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9640                                  Err_Exitj2:
  9641 00000583 EBC8                    		jmp	short err_exitj
  9642                                  
  9643                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9644                                  
  9645                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9646                                  
  9647                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9648                                  ; Build a valid bpb for the disk in the drive.
  9649                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9650                                  
  9651                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9652                                  get_bpb:				; 2C7h:592h = 70h:2B02h

  9664 00000595 C606[0A05]01            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 1
  9665 0000059A E85B00                  		call	GetBp		; build	a bpb if necessary
  9666 0000059D 72B1                    		jb	short ret81
  9667                                  		;cmp	ds:set_id_flag,	2 ; already, volume_label set from boot
  9668 0000059F 803E[0A05]02            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 2
  9669                                  		;mov	ds:set_id_flag,	0 ; record to bds table?
  9670 000005A4 C606[0A05]00            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 0
  9671 000005A9 740A                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; do not set it again from	root dir
  9672                                  					; otherwise, conventional boot record
  9673                                  		;cmp	ds:fhave96, 0	; do we	have changeline	support?
  9674 000005AB 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9675 000005B0 7403                    		jz	short already_gotbpb ; brif not
  9676 000005B2 E86213                  		call	set_volume_id
  9677                                  already_gotbpb:

  9680                                  
  9681                                  ;		 fall into setptrsav, es:di -> result
  9682

  9684                                  
  9685                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9686                                  
  9687                                  ; ==========================================================================
  9688                                  ;Setptrsav is also jumped to from dsk_init (msbio2.asm). In both cases, the
  9689                                  ;pointer to be returned is in es:di. We were incorrectly returning ds:di.
  9690                                  ;Note that this works in most cases because most pointers are in Bios_Data.
  9691                                  ;It fails, for instance, when we install an external drive using driver.sys
  9692                                  ;because then the BDS segment is no longer Bios_Data. 
  9693                                  ;NB: It is fine to corrupt cx because this is not a return value and anyway
  9694                                  ;this returns to Chardev_entry (msbio1.asm) where all registers are 
  9695                                  ;restored before returning to the caller.

  9711                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9712                                  
  9713                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9714                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
  9715                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
  9716                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
  9717                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
  9718                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
  9719                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
  9720                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.
  9721                                  ;
  9722                                  ;	trashes si, cx
  9723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9724                                  
  9725                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
  9726                                  ;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
  9727                                  
  9728                                  clear_ids:
  9729                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)
  9730 000005CC 268A451F                		mov	al, [es:di+1Fh] ; mov al,[es:di+BDS.fatsiz]
  9731                                  clear_ids_x:	; 11/09/2023		
  9732                                   		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05D9h)
  9733 000005D0 57                      		push	di
  9734 000005D1 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx		; no serial number
  9735 000005D3 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9736 000005D7 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
  9737                                  
  9738                                  		; BUGBUG - there's a lot in common here and with
  9739                                  		; mov_media_ids.. see if we can save some space by
  9740                                  		; merging them... jgl
  9741                                  
  9742                                  		;mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9743                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9744 000005DB B10B                    		mov	cl, 11 ; cx = 11		
  9745                                  
  9746                                  		;mov	si, offset vol_no_name ; "NO NAME    "
  9747 000005DD BE[1D05]                		mov	si, vol_no_name	; 19/10/2022
  9748 000005E0 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
  9749 000005E3 F3A4                    		rep movsb
  9750                                  		
  9751                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
  9752                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
  9753                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
  9754                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
  9755                                  
  9756                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
  9757                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9758                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9759                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
  9760                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
  9761                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
  9762                                  			;
  9763                                  			; Correct Code:
  9764                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
  9765                                  			; 11/09/2023
  9766                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
  9767                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
  9768                                  			;
  9769                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
  9770                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
  9771                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
  9772                                  			;
  9773                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
  9774                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
  9775                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
  9776                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
  9777                                  
  9778 000005E5 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
  9779                                  		
  9780                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_16_id ; "FAT16	"
  9781 000005E7 BE[1405]                		mov	si, fat_16_id	; 19/10/2022
  9782 000005EA 7503                    		jnz	short ci_bigfat
  9783                                  		;mov	si, offset fat_12_id ; "FAT12	"
  9784 000005EC BE[0B05]                		mov	si, fat_12_id	 ; 19/10/2022
  9785                                  ci_bigfat:				
  9786                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
  9787                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9788 000005EF B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8 
  9789 000005F1 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
  9790                                  					; filesys_id field
  9791 000005F4 F3A4                    		rep movsb

  9795                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9796                                  
  9797                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9798                                  
  9799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9800                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9801                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9802                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9803                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9804                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9805                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9806                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9807                                  ;
  9808                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9809                                  ;
  9810                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9811                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9812                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9813                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9814                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9815                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9816                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9817                                  ;
  9818                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9819                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9820                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9821                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9822                                  
  9823                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
  9824                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
  9825 000005F8 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
  9826 000005FD 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
  9827 000005FF E99500                  		jmp	getret_exit

  9829

  9836                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all

  9963                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9964                                  
  9965                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9966                                  
  9967                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9968                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9969                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9970                                  ;
  9971                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9972                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9973                                  
  9974                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9975                                  
  9976                                  readbootsec:	
  9977 000006AC B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9978 000006AE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9979 000006B1 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9980 000006B4 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9981 000006B6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9982                                  
  9983                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9984                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9985                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9986                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9987                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9988                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9989                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9990                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9991                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9992                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9993                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9994                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9995                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9996                                  		; informations
  9997                                  
  9998                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9999                                  
 10000                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10001 000006B8 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10002 000006BD 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10003 000006BF 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10004 000006C4 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10005 000006C6 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10006 000006CB 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10007 000006CD 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10008 000006D2 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10009                                  
 10010                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10011                                  ;
 10012                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10013                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10014                                  ;;
 10015                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10016                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10017                                  ;;
 10018                                  ;;check_signature:
 10019                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10020                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10021                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10022                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10023                                  
 10024                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10025                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10026                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10027                                  
 10028                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10029                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
 10030 000006D4 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10031                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10032 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10033 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10034 000006DB 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10035                                  
 10036                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10037                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10038                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10039                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10040                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10041                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10042                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10043                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10044                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10045                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10046                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10047                                  
 10048                                  checksinglesided:
 10049 000006DD A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10050 000006E0 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10051 000006E2 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10052 000006E4 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10053 000006E6 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10054 000006E8 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10055 000006EE 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10056 000006F0 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10057 000006F5 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10058                                  
 10059                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10060                                  
 10061                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10062 000006F7 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10063                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10064 000006FC EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk

 10084                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10085                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10086                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10087                                  ;
 10088                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10089                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10090                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10091                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10092                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10093                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10094                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 10189 0000076C C3                      		retn

 10191                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10192                                  
 10193                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10194                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10195                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10196                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10197                                  ; output:
 10198                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10199                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10200                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10201                                  
 10202                                  readfat:	
 10203                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10204                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10205 0000076D 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10206 0000076F B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10207                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10208 00000772 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10209 00000775 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10210 00000777 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10211                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10212 00000779 C3                      		retn
 10213                                  
 10214                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10215                                  
 10216                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10217                                  
 10218                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10219                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10220                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10221                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10222                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10223                                  ;		dh has head
 10224                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10225                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10226                                  ;
 10227                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10228                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10229                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10230                                  ;
 10231                                  ;		carry set
 10232                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10233                                  ;
 10234                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10235                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10236                                  
 10237                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10238                                  
 10239                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10240                                  read_sector:	
 10241 0000077A 55                      		push	bp
 10242 0000077B BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10243 0000077E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10244 00000782 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10245                                  rd_ret:					
 10246 00000785 06                      		push	es
 10247 00000786 1E                      		push	ds
 10248 00000787 07                      		pop	es
 10249 00000788 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10250 0000078B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10251                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10252                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10253                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10254 0000078D 07                      		pop	es
 10255 0000078E 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10256                                  rd_rty:					
 10257 00000790 E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10258 00000793 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10259 00000795 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10260                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10261                                  					; fnon_removable
 10262 0000079A 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10263 0000079C 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10264 000007A1 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10265 000007A3 50                      		push	ax
 10266 000007A4 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10267 000007A5 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10268                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10269                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10270                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10271                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10272 000007A9 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10273 000007AB 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10274                                  		; 
 10275 000007AE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10276 000007AF A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10277 000007B2 58                      		pop	ax
 10278                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10279 000007B3 06                      		push	es
 10280 000007B4 1E                      		push	ds
 10281 000007B5 07                      		pop	es
 10282 000007B6 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10283 000007B9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10284                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10285                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10286                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10287 000007BB 07                      		pop	es
 10288 000007BC 9C                      		pushf
 10289 000007BD 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10290 000007C2 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10291 000007C4 50                      		push	ax
 10292 000007C5 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10293 000007C8 1E                      		push	ds
 10294 000007C9 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10295 000007CD 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10296 000007D0 1F                      		pop	ds
 10297 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
 10298                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10299 000007D2 9D                      		popf
 10300 000007D3 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10301 000007D5 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10302                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10303                                  
 10304                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10305 000007D7 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10306                                  					; return error
 10307 000007D9 F9                      		stc
 10308                                  
 10309                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10310                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10311                                  
 10312                                  okret2:					
 10313 000007DA 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10314 000007DE 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10315 000007E2 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10316                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10317                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred

 10320 000007EA 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10321 000007EB 5D                      		pop	bp
 10322 000007EC C3                      		retn

 10346 0000080B 7404                    		jz	short exitjx	; watch	out for	wrap
 10347 0000080D 26FF4D20                		dec	word [es:di+20h]
 10348                                  exitjx:					
 10349                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10350                                  		; cf = 0
 10351                                  		;clc		; CF is	already	ZERO here (18/09/2022, MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10352                                  				; (19/07/2019 -	Erdogan	Tan - MSDOS 6.0	IO.SYS - retrodos4.s)
 10353 00000811 C3                      		retn
