 12496                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12497                                  ;	get media id
 12498                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12499                                  ;
 12500                                  ; FUNCTION: get the volume label,the system id and the serial number from
 12501                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 12502                                  ;	    for the conventional media,this routine will return "unknown
 12503                                  ;	    media type" error to dos.
 12504                                  ;
 12505                                  ; INPUT :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 12506                                  ;
 12507                                  ; OUTPUT:   the request packet filled with the information,if not carry.
 12508                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 12509                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12510                                  ;	    register DS,DX,AX,CX,DI,SI destroyed.
 12511                                  ;
 12512                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 12513                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 12514                                  ;
 12515                                  ; LOGIC:
 12516                                  ;	to recognize the extended boot record,this logic will actually
 12517                                  ;	access the boot sector even if it is a hard disk.
 12518                                  ;	note:the valid extended bpb is recognized by looking at the mediabyte
 12519                                  ;	field of bpb and the extended boot signature.
 12520                                  ;
 12521                                  ; {
 12522                                  ;	get logical drive number from bds table;
 12523                                  ;	rFlag = read operation;
 12524                                  ;	BootIo;		 /*get the media boot record into the buffer
 12525                                  ;	if (no error) then
 12526                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 12527                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 12528                                  ;		  of the request packet to those of the boot record;
 12529                                  ;		};
 12530                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 12531                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 12532                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 12533                                  ;		};
 12534                                  ;	else
 12535                                  ;	     ret;	/*already error code is set in the register al
 12536                                  ;
 12537                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12538                                  
 12539                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL equ 4
 12540                                  ;;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11
 12541                                  ;;size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID equ 8
 12542                                  
 12543                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12544                                  GetMediaId:
 12545 0000115E E89F00                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 12546 00001161 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet] ; Logical drive number
 12547 00001165 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; Read operation
 12548 0000116A E87B00                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sector into	DiskSector
 12549 0000116D 7224                    		jb	short IOCtl_If1
 12550                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 12551 0000116F 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 12552                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 12553 00001174 721A                    		jb	short IOCtl_If2	; brif not valid (0F0h - 0FFh)
 12554                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12555 00001176 BE[7401]                		mov	si, disksector+26h
 12556 00001179 803C29                  		cmp	byte [si], 29h
 12557                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 12558                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 12559 0000117C 7512                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If2	; not extended boot record
 12560 0000117E C43E[1200]              		les	di, [ptrsav]	; es:di	points to request header
 12561 00001182 26C47F13                		les	di, [es:bx+19]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12562                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12563 00001186 46                      		inc	si
 12564                                  		; si = disksector+27h 
 12565                                  		;mov	si, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 12566 00001187 83C702                  		add	di, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 12567 0000118A B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 12568                                  					; L+size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 12569                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 12570 0000118D F3A4                    		rep movsb		; Move from Bios_Data into request packet
 12571                                  	
 12572                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12573                                  		; cf = 0
 12574                                  		;clc
 12575                                  
 12576 0000118F C3                      		retn
 12577                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12578                                  
 12579                                  IOCtl_If2:				
 12580 00001190 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 12581 00001192 F9                      		stc
 12582                                  IOCtl_If1:				
 12583 00001193 C3                      		retn
 12584                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12585                                  
 12586                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12587                                  
 12588                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12589                                  ;  set media id
 12590                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12591                                  
 12592                                  ; function: set the volume label, the system id and the serial number of
 12593                                  ;	    the media that has the extended boot record.
 12594                                  ;	    for the conventional media, this routine will return "unknown
 12595                                  ;	    media.." error to dos.
 12596                                  ;	    this routine will also set the corresponding informations in
 12597                                  ;	    the bds table.
 12598                                  ;
 12599                                  ; input :   ES:di -> bds table for this drive.
 12600                                  ;
 12601                                  ; output:   the extended boot record in the media will be set according to
 12602                                  ;	    the request packet.
 12603                                  ;	    if carry set, then al contains the device driver error number
 12604                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12605                                  ;
 12606                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 12607                                  ;	BootIo:NEAR
 12608                                  ;
 12609                                  ; logic:
 12610                                  ;
 12611                                  ; {
 12612                                  ;	get drive_number from bds;
 12613                                  ;	rFlag = "read operation";
 12614                                  ;	BootIo;
 12615                                  ;	if (no error) then
 12616                                  ;	     if (extended boot record) then
 12617                                  ;		{ set volume label,volume serial number and system id
 12618                                  ;		  of the boot record to those of the request packet;
 12619                                  ;		  rFlag = "write operation";
 12620                                  ;		  get drive number from bds;
 12621                                  ;		  BootIo;	  /*write it back*/
 12622                                  ;		};
 12623                                  ;	     else		  /*not an extended bpb */
 12624                                  ;		{ set register al to "unknown media.." error code;
 12625                                  ;		  set carry bit;
 12626                                  ;		  ret;	 /*return back to caller */
 12627                                  ;		};
 12628                                  ;	else
 12629                                  ;	     ret;		 /*already error code is set */
 12630                                  ;
 12631                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12632                                  
 12633                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12634                                  SetMediaId:
 12635 00001194 E86900                  		call	ChangeLineChk
 12636 00001197 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 12637                                  					; Logical drive	number
 12638 0000119B 88C2                    		mov	dl, al
 12639 0000119D C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2	; romread
 12640 000011A2 52                      		push	dx
 12641 000011A3 E84200                  		call	BootIo		; Read boot sec	to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 12642 000011A6 5A                      		pop	dx
 12643 000011A7 723E                    		jb	short IOCtl_If6
 12644                                  					; Valid? (0F0h-0FFh?)
 12645 000011A9 803E[6301]F0            		cmp	byte [disksector+15h], 0F0h
 12646                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 12647 000011AE 7234                    		jb	short IOCtl_If7	; Brif not
 12648 000011B0 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h ; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG]
 12649                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 12650 000011B5 752D                    		jnz	short IOCtl_If7	; not extended boot record
 12651 000011B7 06                      		push	es		; Save BDS pointer
 12652 000011B8 57                      		push	di
 12653 000011B9 1E                      		push	ds		; Point	ES To boot record
 12654 000011BA 07                      		pop	es
 12655 000011BB BF[7501]                		mov	di, disksector+27h ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL
 12656 000011BE C536[1200]              		lds	si, [ptrsav]	; ds:si	points to request header.
 12657 000011C2 C57413                  		lds	si, [si+19]	; [si+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12658 000011C5 83C602                  		add	si, 2		; A_MEDIA_ID_INFO.MI_SERIAL
 12659 000011C8 B91700                  		mov	cx, 23		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_SERIAL
 12660                                  					; +size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 12661                                  					; +size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 12662 000011CB F3A4                    		rep movsb
 12663 000011CD 06                      		push	es		; point	ds back	to Bios_Data
 12664 000011CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 12665 000011CF 5F                      		pop	di		; restore bds pointer
 12666 000011D0 07                      		pop	es
 12667 000011D1 E864F5                  		call	mov_media_ids	; update the bds media id info.
 12668 000011D4 88D0                    		mov	al, dl
 12669 000011D6 C606[2001]03            		mov	byte [rflag], 3	; romwrite
 12670 000011DB E80A00                  		call	BootIo		; write	it back.
 12671 000011DE C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh
 12672                                  					; make sure chk_media check the driver
 12673                                  					; return with error code from BootIo
 12674 000011E3 C3                      		retn
 12675                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12676                                  
 12677                                  IOCtl_If7:				
 12678 000011E4 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; error_unknown_media
 12679 000011E6 F9                      		stc
 12680                                  IOCtl_If6:				
 12681 000011E7 C3                      		retn
 12682                                  
 12683                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12684                                  
 12685                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12686                                  
 12687                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12688                                  ;	BootIo
 12689                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12690                                  ;
 12691                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 12692                                  ;
 12693                                  ; input :
 12694                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 12695                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 12696                                  ;
 12697                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 12698                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 12699                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 12700                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 12701                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 12702                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12703                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 12704                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 12705                                  ;
 12706                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 12707                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 12708                                  ;
 12709                                  ; logic:
 12710                                  ;
 12711                                  ; {
 12712                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 12713                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 12714                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 12715                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 12716                                  ; }
 12717                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12718                                  
 12719                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12720                                  BootIo:	
 12721 000011E8 06                      		push	es
 12722 000011E9 57                      		push	di
 12723 000011EA 53                      		push	bx
 12724 000011EB 1E                      		push	ds
 12725 000011EC 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 12726                                  
 12727                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 12728                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 12729                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 12730                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 12731                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 12732                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 12733                                  
 12734 000011ED BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 12735 000011F0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 12736 000011F2 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 12737 000011F6 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 12738 000011F9 E8CEF6                  		call	diskio
 12739 000011FC 5B                      		pop	bx
 12740 000011FD 5F                      		pop	di
 12741 000011FE 07                      		pop	es
 12742 000011FF C3                      		retn
 12743                                  
 12744                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12745                                  
 12746                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12747                                  
 12748                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12749                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 12750                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12751                                  ;
 12752                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 12753                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 12754                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 12755                                  ; history in the flags.
 12756                                  ;
 12757                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 12758                                  ;
 12759                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 12760                                  ;
 12761                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 12762                                  ;
 12763                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 12764                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 12765                                  ;
 12766                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12767                                  
 12768                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 12769 00001200 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12770 00001204 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 12771 00001206 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 12772                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12773 00001208 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 12774                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12775                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 12776 0000120D 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12777 0000120F 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 12778 00001214 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12779 00001216 E8F806                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 12780 00001219 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 12781                                  
 12782                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 12783                                  
 12784 0000121B B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 12785 0000121D CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 12786                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 12787                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 12788 0000121F 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12789 00001221 53                      		push	bx
 12790 00001222 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 12791                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 12792                                  					; physical drive
 12793 00001225 E8C206                  		call	set_changed_dl
 12794 00001228 5B                      		pop	bx
 12795                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 12796 00001229 C3                      		retn
 12797                                  
 12798                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12799                                  
 12800                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12801                                  
 12802                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12803                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 12804                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12805                                  ;
 12806                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12807                                  ;
 12808                                  ; INPUT :
 12809                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12810                                  ;
 12811                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 12812                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 12813                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12814                                  
 12815                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12816                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 12817 0000122A C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 12818 0000122E C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12819                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 12820                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12821 00001231 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 12822                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12823 00001233 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12824                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12825                                  					; unformatted_media
 12826 00001238 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 12827 0000123A FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 12828                                  
 12829                                  GafDone:				
 12830 0000123C 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12831 0000123F C3                      		retn
 12832                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12833                                  
 12834                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12835                                  
 12836                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12837                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 12838                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12839                                  ;
 12840                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12841                                  ;
 12842                                  ; input :
 12843                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12844                                  ;
 12845                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 12846                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12847                                  
 12848                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12849                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 12850 00001240 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 12851 00001244 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12852                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12853 00001247 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 12854                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12855                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 12856 0000124C 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12857 00001250 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 12858                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12859 00001252 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12860                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12861                                  					; unformatted_media
 12862                                  saf_Done:				
 12863 00001257 C3                      		retn
 12864                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12865

 12868                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12869                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 12870                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12871                                  ;
 12872                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 12873                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 12874                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 12875                                  ;
 12876                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12877                                  
 12878                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12879                                  ioctl_support_query:
 12880 00001258 06                      		push	es
 12881 00001259 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 12882 0000125D 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 12883                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 12884 00001261 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 12885                                  					; See if major code is 8
 12886 00001263 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 12887 00001265 0E                      		push	cs
 12888 00001266 07                      		pop	es
 12889 00001267 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 12890                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12891 0000126A BF[3B0C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 12892                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 12893                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 12894 0000126D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 12895 0000126F F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 12896 00001271 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 12897 00001273 B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 12898                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12899                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 12900                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 12901                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 12902                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 12903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12904                                  ioctlsupexit:				
 12905 00001276 07                      		pop	es
 12906                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12907                                  		; cf = 0
 12908                                  		;clc
 12909 00001277 C3                      		retn
 12910                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12911                                  nosupport:				
 12912 00001278 07                      		pop	es
 12913 00001279 E959EE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 12914                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12915                                  
 12916                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12917                                  
 12918                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12919                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 12920                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12921                                  ;
 12922                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 12923                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 12924                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 12925                                  ;	    drive)
 12926                                  ;
 12927                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 12928                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 12929                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 12930                                  ;
 12931                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 12932                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 12933                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 12934                                  ;
 12935                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 12936                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 12937                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 12938                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 12939                                  ;
 12940                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 12941                                  ;
 12942                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 12943                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 12944                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 12945                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 12946                                  ; 
 12947                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12948                                  
 12949                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12950                                  SenseMediaType:				
 12951 0000127C C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 12952 00001280 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12953                                  		; 10/10/2022
 12954                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 12955 00001283 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 12956 00001285 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 12957                                  		;
 12958 00001287 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12959                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 12960                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12961                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 12962 0000128B B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 12963                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 12964 0000128D CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 12965 0000128F 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 12966 00001291 FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 12967                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 12968 00001293 FEC8                    		dec	al
 12969 00001295 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 12970 00001297 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 12971 00001299 0404                    		add	al, 4
 12972 0000129B 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 12973 0000129D 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 12974 0000129F 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 12975 000012A1 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 12976                                  GotMediaType:				
 12977 000012A3 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 12978                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12979                                  		; cf = 0
 12980                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 12981 000012A6 C3                      		retn
 12982                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12983                                  
 12984                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 12985 000012A7 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 12986 000012AA 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 12987 000012AC B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 12988 000012AE 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 12989 000012B1 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 12990                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 12991 000012B3 B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 12992                                  SenseErrExit:				
 12993 000012B5 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 12994 000012B7 F9                      		stc
 12995 000012B8 C3                      		retn
 12996                                  
 12997                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12998                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12999                                  		;db    0
 13000                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13001                                  
 13002                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13003                                  
 13004                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13005                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13006                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13007                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13008                                  
 13009                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13010                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13011                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13012                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13013                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13014                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13015                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13016                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13017                                  ;
 13018                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13019                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13020                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13021                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13022                                  ;
 13023                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13024                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13025                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13026                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13027                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13028                                  ;
 13029                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13030                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13031                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13032                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13033                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13034                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13035                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13036                                  
 13037                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13038                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13039                                  
 13040                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13041                                  
 13042                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13043 000012B9 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13044 000012BC 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13045 000012BE 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13046 000012C1 743B                    		jz	short mine
 13047                                  
 13048                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13049                                  
 13050 000012C3 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13051 000012C6 7479                    		jz	short win386call
 13052 000012C8 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13053 000012CB 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13054 000012CD E9A500                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13055                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13056                                  
 13057                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13058 000012D0 CF                      		iret
 13059                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13060                                  
 13061                                  int2f_replace_int13:			
 13062 000012D1 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13063 000012D2 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13064                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13065                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13066                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13067 000012D4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13068                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13069                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13070                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13071                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13072                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13073 000012D9 FF36[B400]              		push	word [Orig13]
 13074 000012DD FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13075 000012E1 FF36[0601]              		push	word [Old13]
 13076 000012E5 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13077                                  
 13078                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13079                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13080                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13081                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13082 000012E9 8916[B400]              		mov	[Orig13], dx
 13083 000012ED A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13084 000012F0 891E[0601]              		mov	[Old13], bx
 13085 000012F4 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13086                                  
 13087 000012F8 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13088 000012F9 5B                      		pop	bx
 13089 000012FA 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13090 000012FB 5A                      		pop	dx
 13091 000012FC 58                      		pop	ax
 13092                                  i2f_iret:				
 13093 000012FD CF                      		iret
 13094                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13095                                  
 13096                                  mine:					
 13097 000012FE 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13098 00001300 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13099 00001302 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13100 00001304 7504                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13101 00001306 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13102 00001308 EBF3                    		jmp	short i2f_iret
 13103                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13104                                  
 13105                                  disp_func:				
 13106 0000130A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13107 0000130C 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13108 0000130E 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13109 00001310 7424                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13110                                  
 13111                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13112                                  
 13113 00001312 1E                      		push	ds
 13114 00001313 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13115                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13116                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13117                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13118                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13119                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 13120 00001318 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 13121 0000131C 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 13122 00001320 1F                      		pop	ds
 13123                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 13124                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13125                                  		;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry		
 13126 00001321 EA[9608]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 13127                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 13128                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13129                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13130                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 13131                                  
 13132                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13133                                  
 13134                                  do_subfun_01:				
 13135 00001326 06                      		push	es
 13136 00001327 1E                      		push	ds
 13137 00001328 1E                      		push	ds
 13138 00001329 07                      		pop	es
 13139                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13140 0000132A 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]	
 13141                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13142                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13143 0000132F E8C303                  		call	install_bds
 13144 00001332 1F                      		pop	ds
 13145 00001333 07                      		pop	es
 13146 00001334 EBC7                    		jmp	short i2f_iret
 13147                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13148                                  
 13149                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13150                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13151 00001336 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 13152                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13153 0000133B C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13154                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13155                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022				
 13156 0000133F EBBC                    		jmp	short i2f_iret
 13157                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13158                                  
 13159                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13160                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13161                                  
 13162                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13163                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13164                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13165                                  
 13166                                  win386call:				
 13167 00001341 1E                      		push	ds
 13168 00001342 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13169                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13170                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13171 00001347 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13172                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13173 00001349 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13174 0000134B 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13175                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13176 0000134D 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13177                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13178 0000134F F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13179                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13180 00001352 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13181                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13182 00001354 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13183 00001359 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13184                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13185                                  
 13186                                  Win386Init:	
 13187                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13188 0000135B F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 13189                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13190 0000135E 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13191                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13192 00001360 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13193                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13194                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13195 00001365 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13196 00001369 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13197                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13198 0000136D BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13199 00001370 1E                      		push	ds
 13200 00001371 07                      		pop	es
 13201                                  win_iret:				
 13202 00001372 1F                      		pop	ds
 13203                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 13204 00001373 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13205                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13206                                  
 13207                                  handle_multmult:			
 13208 00001375 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13209 00001377 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 13210 00001379 1E                      		push	ds
 13211 0000137A E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13212                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13213                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13214                                  		;dec	bx
 13215 0000137D BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13216 00001380 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13217 00001382 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13218 00001384 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13219 00001386 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13220 00001388 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13221 0000138A 43                      		inc	bx
 13222                                  try_1:					
 13223 0000138B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13224 0000138C EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13226                                  
 13227                                  try_2:					
 13228 0000138E 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13229 00001390 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13230 00001392 1E                      		push	ds
 13231                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13232                                  		;xor	di, di
 13233                                  		;dec	di
 13234 00001393 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13235 00001396 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13236 00001398 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13237 0000139B 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13238 0000139E 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13239 000013A0 F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13240 000013A2 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13241 000013A4 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13242                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13243                                  		;sub	di, di
 13244                                  		;dec	di
 13245 000013A6 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13246 000013A9 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13247                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13248                                  
 13249                                  try_4:					
 13250                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13251 000013AB 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13252 000013AF 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13253                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13254                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13255 000013B2 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13256                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13257 000013B5 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13258 000013B9 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA
 13259 000013BB C706[F508]FFFF          		mov	word [FreeHMAPtr], 0FFFFh ; -1
 13260                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13261                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13262                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13263 000013C1 1F                      		pop	ds
 13264                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13265                                  try_3:		
 13266 000013C2 EBAF                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13267                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13268                                  
 13269                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13270                                  ;try_3:					
 13271                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret
 13272                                  
 13273                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13274                                  
 13275                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13276                                  
 13277                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13278                                  ;
 13279                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13280                                  ;
 13281                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13282                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13283                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13284                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13285                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13286                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13287                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13288                                  ;
 13289                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13290                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13291                                  ;
 13292                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13293                                  
 13294                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13295                                  HMAPtr:
 13296 000013C4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13297                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13298 000013C9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13299                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13300 000013CD 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13301 000013D0 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13302 000013D2 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13303                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13304 000013D7 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13305 000013D9 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13306                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13307 000013DD 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13308                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13309                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13310 000013E1 C3                      		retn
 13311                                  
 13312                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13313                                  
 13314                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13315                                  
 13316                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13317                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13318                                  
 13319                                  move_sector:
 13320                                  
 13321                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13322                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13323                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13324                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13325                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13326                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13327                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13328                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13329                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13330                                  ;
 13331                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13332                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13333                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13334                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13335                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13336                                  
 13337 000013E2 FC                      		cld
 13338 000013E3 51                      		push	cx
 13339 000013E4 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13340 000013E7 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13341 000013EB 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13342 000013ED 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13343 000013F1 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13344 000013F3 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13345 000013F5 59                      		pop	cx
 13346 000013F6 C3                      		retn
 13347                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13348                                  
 13349                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13350 000013F7 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13351 000013F9 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13352 000013FB 59                      		pop	cx
 13353 000013FC C3                      		retn
 13354                                  
 13355                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13356                                  
 13357                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13358                                  
 13359                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13360                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13361                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13362                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13363                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13364                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13365                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13366                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13367                                  ;
 13368                                  ; input conditions:
 13369                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13370                                  ;
 13371                                  ; output:
 13372                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13373                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13374                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13375                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13376                                  
 13377                                  check_wrap:	
 13378 000013FD 50                      		push	ax
 13379 000013FE 53                      		push	bx
 13380 000013FF 06                      		push	es
 13381 00001400 57                      		push	di
 13382 00001401 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13383 00001404 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13384                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13385 00001406 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13386                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13387 0000140B 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13388 0000140D 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13389 00001411 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13390 00001413 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13391 00001416 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13392 00001418 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13393 0000141A F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13394                                  
 13395                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13396                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13397                                  
 13398 0000141C 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13399 0000141E 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13400                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13401 00001420 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13402 00001421 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13403                                  					; if on	boundary
 13404                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13405                                  not_on_bound:				
 13406 00001423 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13407 00001426 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13408 00001428 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13409 0000142A 40                      		inc	ax
 13410 0000142B 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13411 0000142D 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13412 00001430 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13413                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13414 00001434 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13415 00001436 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13416 00001437 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13417 00001439 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13418 0000143D F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13419                                  
 13420                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13421                                  
 13422 0000143F 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13423 00001441 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13424 00001443 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13425                                  
 13426                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13427                                  
 13428 00001445 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13429 00001447 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13430 00001449 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13431                                  no_head_bound:				
 13432 0000144A 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13433 0000144C 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13434 0000144D FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13435 0000144F 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13436 00001451 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13437 00001453 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13438 00001456 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13439 00001458 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13440 0000145A D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13441 0000145C 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13442 0000145E 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13443 00001460 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13444 00001462 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13445 00001464 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13446                                  no_wrap:				
 13447 00001466 F8                      		clc
 13448 00001467 5F                      		pop	di
 13449 00001468 07                      		pop	es
 13450 00001469 5B                      		pop	bx
 13451 0000146A 58                      		pop	ax
 13452 0000146B C3                      		retn
 13453                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13454                                  
 13455                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13456 0000146C 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13457 0000146E FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13458 00001470 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13459                                  
 13460                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13461                                  
 13462                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13463                                  
 13464                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13465                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13466                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13467                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13468                                  ;
 13469                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13470                                  
 13471                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13472                                  find_bds:	
 13473 00001472 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13474                                  fbds_1:					
 13475 00001476 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13476 0000147A 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13477 0000147C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13478                                  					; go to next bds
 13479 0000147F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13480 00001482 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13481 00001484 F9                      		stc
 13482                                  fdbs_2:					
 13483 00001485 C3                      		retn
 13484                                  
 13485                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13486                                  
 13487                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13488                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13489                                  doint:
 13490                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13491 00001486 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13492                                  					; get physical drive number
 13493                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13494                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13495                                  		
 13496 00001489 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13497 0000148B 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13498 0000148D 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13499                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13500 0000148F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13501                                  					; get request code
 13502                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13503 00001492 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13504                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13505 00001495 9D                      		popf
 13506                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13507                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13508 00001496 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13509                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13510                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13511 0000149B 9C                      		pushf
 13512                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13513 0000149C 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13514                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13515                                  dointdone:				
 13516 0000149F C3                      		retn
 13517                                  
 13518                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13519                                  
 13520                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13521                                  
 13522                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13523                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13524                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13525                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13526                                  ;
 13527                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13528                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13529                                  ;
 13530                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13531                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13532                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13533                                  
 13534                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13535                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13536                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13537                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13538                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13539                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13540                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13541                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13542                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13543                                  ;end struc
 13544                                  
 13545                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13546                                  
 13547                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13548                                  ;	ah = function
 13549                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13550                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13551                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13552                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13553                                  ;   output conditions:
 13554                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13555                                  
 13556                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13557                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13558                                  ;
 13559                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13560                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13561                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13562                                  
 13563                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13564                                  
 13565                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13566                                  
 13567 000014A0 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13568                                  
 13569                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13570                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13571                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13572                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13573                                  
 13574                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13575                                  
 13576                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13577                                  
 13578                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13579                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13580                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13581                                  
 13582                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13583 000014A4 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13584 000014A9 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13585 000014AB 53                      		push	bx
 13586 000014AC BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13587 000014AF E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13588 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 13589 000014B3 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13590                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13591                                  
 13592                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13593                                  
 13594                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13595                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13596                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13597                                  
 13598                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13599                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13600 000014B5 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13601 000014B7 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13602 000014B9 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13603 000014BA 51                      		push	cx
 13604 000014BB 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13605 000014BD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13606 000014BF D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13607 000014C1 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13608 000014C5 59                      		pop	cx
 13609 000014C6 58                      		pop	ax
 13610 000014C7 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13611                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13612 000014C9 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13613 000014CA 06                      		push	es
 13614                                  		; 17/10/2022
