 13615 000014CB 2EC41E[A014]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13616                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13617                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13618 000014D0 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13619 000014D2 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13620 000014D5 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13621                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13622                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13623 000014D9 07                      		pop	es
 13624 000014DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 13625 000014DB EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13626                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13627                                  
 13628                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13629                                  
 13630                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13631                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13632                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13633                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13634                                  
 13635                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13636 000014DD 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13637                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13638 000014E2 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13639 000014E4 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13640                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13641 000014E9 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13642                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13643 000014EB 50                      		push	ax
 13644 000014EC B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13645                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13646                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13647 000014EE 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13648                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13649                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13650 000014F3 58                      		pop	ax
 13651 000014F4 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13652                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13653                                  
 13654                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13655                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13656                                  
 13657                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13658                                  
 13659                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13660                                  
 13661                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13662                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13663                                  
 13664                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13665 000014F6 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13666                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13667                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13668 000014F7 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13669                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13670                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13671                                  
 13672                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13673                                  
 13674 000014FC A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13675 000014FF 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13676 00001502 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13677                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13678                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13679 00001504 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13680 00001509 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13681                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13682                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13683                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13684 0000150B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13685                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13686                                  		
 13687 00001510 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13688                                  		
 13689 00001511 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13690                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13691 00001516 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13692                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13693                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13694 00001518 9D                      		popf
 13695 00001519 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13696                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13697 0000151B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13698 0000151C CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13699                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13700                                  
 13701                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13702                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13703                                  ; a changeline error.
 13704                                  
 13705                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13706 0000151F 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13707                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13708 00001521 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13709 00001524 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13710 00001526 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13711 00001528 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13712 0000152A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13713 0000152F 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13714                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13715                                  					; never	would
 13716 00001531 53                      		push	bx
 13717 00001532 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13718 00001535 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13719 00001538 5B                      		pop	bx
 13720                                  int13b:					
 13721 00001539 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13722 0000153A EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13723                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13724                                  
 13725                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13726                                  
 13727                                  goterr13:				
 13728 0000153C 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13729 0000153F 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13730                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13731 00001541 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13732 00001544 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13733 00001546 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13734 0000154B 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13735                                  
 13736 0000154D 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13737                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13738                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13739                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13740 00001552 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13741                                  
 13742 00001554 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13743                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13744                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13745 00001556 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13746                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13747                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13748 0000155B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13749 0000155E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13750 00001560 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13751 00001562 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13752 00001564 53                      		push	bx
 13753 00001565 51                      		push	cx
 13754 00001566 52                      		push	dx
 13755 00001567 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13756                                  loop_ecc:				
 13757 0000156A B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13758                                  
 13759                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13760                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13761                                  ;
 13762                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13763                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13764                                  ; track.
 13765                                  ;
 13766                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13767                                  ; this request.
 13768                                  ;
 13769                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13770                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13771                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13772                                  ;
 13773 0000156D E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13774                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13775                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13776 00001570 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13777                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13778 00001575 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13779 00001577 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13780 0000157A 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13781 0000157C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13782 0000157F 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13783                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13784                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13785                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13786 00001581 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13787                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13788                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13789                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13790                                  ok11_op:				
 13791 00001583 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13792 00001587 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13793 00001589 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13794                                  					; add 200h to address
 13795 0000158B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13796 0000158D FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13797 0000158F EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13798                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13799                                  
 13800                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13801                                  
 13802                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13803 00001591 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13804                                  ok11_exit:				
 13805 00001592 5A                      		pop	dx
 13806 00001593 59                      		pop	cx
 13807 00001594 5B                      		pop	bx
 13808 00001595 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13809                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13810                                  
 13811                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13812                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13813                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13814                                  
 13815                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13816 00001597 06                      		push	es
 13817 00001598 53                      		push	bx
 13818 00001599 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13819 0000159C 1E                      		push	ds
 13820 0000159D 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13821 0000159E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13822                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13823                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13824 000015A1 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13825                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13826 000015A6 5B                      		pop	bx
 13827 000015A7 07                      		pop	es
 13828 000015A8 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13829 000015AA 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13830 000015AD 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13831                                  
 13832                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13833                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13834                                  
 13835                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13836 000015AF 56                      		push	si
 13837 000015B0 57                      		push	di
 13838 000015B1 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13839 000015B3 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13840 000015B6 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13841 000015B9 5F                      		pop	di
 13842 000015BA 5E                      		pop	si
 13843 000015BB EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13844                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13845                                  
 13846                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13847                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13848                                  
 13849                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13850 000015BD A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13851 000015C0 FB                      		sti
 13852 000015C1 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13853 000015C4 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13854                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13855                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13856 000015C6 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13857 000015C9 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13858 000015CB 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13859 000015CE 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13860 000015D0 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13861                                  
 13862                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13863                                  
 13864                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13865                                  
 13866 000015D2 52                      		push	dx
 13867 000015D3 51                      		push	cx
 13868 000015D4 53                      		push	bx
 13869 000015D5 50                      		push	ax
 13870 000015D6 55                      		push	bp
 13871 000015D7 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13872 000015D9 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13873 000015DB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13874 000015DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13875 000015DF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13876 000015E1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13877 000015E3 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13878 000015E5 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13879                                  
 13880                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13881                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13882                                  
 13883 000015E9 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13884 000015EB E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13886                                  
 13887                                  no_skip_first:				
 13888 000015EE D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13889 000015F0 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13890 000015F2 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13891                                  
 13892                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13893                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13894                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13895                                  ;
 13896                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13897                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13898                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13899                                  ; in error.
 13900                                  
 13901 000015F4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13902 000015F6 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13903                                  
 13904                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13905                                  
 13906 000015F8 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13907                                  					; set up head number
 13908 000015FB E888FE                  		call	doint
 13909 000015FE E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13910                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13911                                  
 13912                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13913 00001601 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13914 00001603 F9                      		stc
 13915 00001604 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13916                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13917                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13918                                  
 13919                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13920                                  
 13921                                  intverify:				
 13922 00001607 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13923 00001608 53                      		push	bx
 13924 00001609 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13925 0000160A 07                      		pop	es
 13926                                  dosimple:				
 13927 0000160B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13928                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13929                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13930                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13931 0000160E 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13932                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13933 00001613 5B                      		pop	bx
 13934 00001614 07                      		pop	es
 13935 00001615 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13936                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13937                                  
 13938                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13939                                  
 13940                                  intformat:				
 13941 00001618 06                      		push	es
 13942 00001619 53                      		push	bx
 13943 0000161A 56                      		push	si
 13944 0000161B 57                      		push	di
 13945 0000161C 1E                      		push	ds
 13946                                  
 13947                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13948                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13949                                  
 13950 0000161D 06                      		push	es
 13951 0000161E 1E                      		push	ds
 13952 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 13953 00001620 1F                      		pop	ds
 13954 00001621 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13955 00001623 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13956 00001626 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13957 00001629 1F                      		pop	ds
 13958 0000162A 5F                      		pop	di
 13959 0000162B 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13960 0000162C EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13961                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13962                                  
 13963                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13964                                  ; the first block.
 13965                                  ;
 13966                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13967                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13968                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13969                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13970                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13971                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13972                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13973                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13974                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13975                                  
 13976                                  doblock:
 13977                                  
 13978                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13979                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13980                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13981                                  				
 13982 0000162E 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13983                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13984 00001631 51                      		push	cx
 13985 00001632 06                      		push	es
 13986 00001633 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13987                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13988 00001634 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13989 00001637 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13990                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13991 0000163B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13992                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13993 00001640 5F                      		pop	di
 13994 00001641 07                      		pop	es
 13995 00001642 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13996 00001644 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13997 00001646 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13998 00001648 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13999                                  doblockflop:				
 14000 0000164A 59                      		pop	cx
 14001                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14002 0000164B 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14003 0000164D 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14004 0000164F 50                      		push	ax
 14005 00001650 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14006 00001652 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14007                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14008                                  
 14009                                  doblocklast:				
 14010 00001654 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14011 00001656 50                      		push	ax
 14012                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14013 00001657 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14014 0000165A 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14015 0000165C 58                      		pop	ax
 14016 0000165D 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14017                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14018 00001660 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14019 00001662 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14020 00001664 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14021 00001666 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14022 00001668 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14023                                  					; then we are done already.
 14024 0000166A 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14025                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14026 0000166C E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14027 0000166F EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14029                                  
 14030                                  bufferx:				
 14031 00001671 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14032                                  					; set up head number
 14033                                  buffer:					
 14034 00001674 53                      		push	bx
 14035 00001675 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14036 00001678 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14037 0000167B 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14038                                  					
 14039                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14040                                  
 14041 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 14042 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds
 14043 0000167F 56                      		push	si
 14044 00001680 57                      		push	di
 14045 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14046 00001682 06                      		push	es
 14047 00001683 1F                      		pop	ds
 14048 00001684 07                      		pop	es
 14049 00001685 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14050 00001688 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14051 00001689 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14052 0000168B E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14053 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14054                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14055 0000168F 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14056 00001690 5E                      		pop	si
 14057 00001691 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14058                                  
 14059                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14060                                  
 14061 00001692 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14062                                  					; get drive number
 14063 00001694 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14064 00001697 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14065                                  					;
 14066                                  					; ah is	function
 14067                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14068                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14069                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14070                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14071                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14072 0000169A E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14073 0000169D 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14074 0000169E 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14075 000016A0 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14076                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14077                                  
 14078                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14079                                  
 14080                                  doread:					
 14081 000016A2 06                      		push	es
 14082 000016A3 53                      		push	bx
 14083 000016A4 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14084 000016A5 07                      		pop	es
 14085 000016A6 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14086 000016A9 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14087 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14088                                  					; get drive number
 14089 000016AE E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14090                                  					; ah = function
 14091                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14092                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14093                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14094 000016B1 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14095 000016B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 14096 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
 14097 000016B6 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14098 000016B8 56                      		push	si
 14099 000016B9 57                      		push	di
 14100 000016BA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14101 000016BC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14102 000016BF E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 14103 000016C2 5F                      		pop	di
 14104 000016C3 5E                      		pop	si
 14105                                  
 14106                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14107                                  
 14108                                  dotail:					
 14109 000016C4 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14110 000016C5 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14111 000016C8 41                      		inc	cx
 14112 000016C9 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14113 000016CC F8                      		clc
 14114 000016CD FEC8                    		dec	al
 14115 000016CF 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14116                                  
 14117                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14118                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14119                                  
 14120 000016D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14121 000016D4 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14122 000016D7 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14123                                  
 14124                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14125                                  
 14126                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14127                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14128                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14129                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14130                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14131                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14132                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14133                                  
 14134                                  bad13:					
 14135 000016DA 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14136 000016DC 5D                      		pop	bp
 14137 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 14138 000016DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 14139 000016DF 59                      		pop	cx
 14140 000016E0 5A                      		pop	dx
 14141 000016E1 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14142 000016E3 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14143                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14144                                  
 14145                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14146 000016E6 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14147                                  
 14148                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14149                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14150                                  		;db 	0
 14151                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14152                                  
 14153                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 14154                                  
 14155                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14156                                  
 14157                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14158                                  ; MSBIO2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 14159                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14160                                  ; 17/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14161                                  
 14162                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14163                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 14164 000016E9 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]
 14165 000016ED BF[8706]                		mov	di, dskdrvs
 14166 000016F0 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 14167 000016F1 07                      		pop	es
 14168 000016F2 E9C3EE                  		jmp	SetPtrSav
 14169                                  
 14170                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14171                                  
 14172                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14173                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14174                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14175                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14176                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14177                                  
 14178                                  install_bds:		
 14179 000016F5 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14180 000016F6 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14181                                  
 14182                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14183                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14184                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14185 000016F9 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14186                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14187 000016FB 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14188 000016FF 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14189                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14190 00001702 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14191 00001704 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14192 00001706 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14193                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14194 0000170A 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14195 0000170D 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14196                                  					; we don't own it
 14197 00001712 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14198                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14199 00001715 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14200 00001718 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14201                                  next_bds:				
 14202 0000171C 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14203                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14204 0000171F 75D8                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14205 00001721 8C4402                  		mov	word [si+2], es ; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14206                                  					; install bds
 14207 00001724 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14208 00001726 26C705FFFF              		mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14209                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14210 0000172B 1F                      		pop	ds
 14211                                  
 14212                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14213                                  ;
 14214                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14215                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14216                                  ;
 14217                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14218                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14219                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14220                                  ;
 14221                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14222                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14223                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14224                                  
 14225 0000172C C3                      		retn
 14226

 14234                                  SNGMSG equ sngmsg

 14243                                  
 14244                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14245 0000172D F606[CE08]01            swpdsk:		test	byte [IsWin386], 1			
 14246                                  		;test	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Is win386 present?
 14247 00001732 7405                    		jz	short no_win386	; no, skip SetFocus
 14248                                  		
 14249                                  		; set focus to the correct VM
 14250                                  		;;call	far 70h:8D1h	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:179Ah
 14251                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14252 00001734 9A[CF08]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14253                                  		;call	far ptr	V86_Crit_SetFocus ; call far 70h:8D1h
 14254                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus
 14255                                  no_win386:				
 14256 00001739 51                      		push	cx
 14257 0000173A 52                      		push	dx
 14258 0000173B 268A5505                		mov	dl, [es:di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 14259                                  					; get the drive	letter
 14260                                  
 14261                                  ; WARNING : next two instructions assume that if the new disk is for drive B
 14262                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
 14263                                  
 14264 0000173F 88D6                    		mov	dh, dl
 14265 00001741 80F601                  		xor	dh, 1
 14266 00001744 29C9                    		sub	cx, cx		; nobody has handled swap disk
 14267 00001746 B8004A                  		mov	ax, 4A00h	; multMULT<<8)|multMULTSWPDSK
 14268                                  					; broad	cast code for swap disk
 14269                                  					; Broadcast it
 14270 00001749 CD2F                    		int	2Fh	
 14271 0000174B 41                      		inc	cx		; cx == -1 ?
 14272 0000174C 741E                    		jz	short swpdsk9	; somebody has handled it
 14273                                  
 14274                                  ; using a different drive in a one drive system so request the user change disks
 14275                                  
 14276 0000174E 80C241                  		add	dl, 'A'
 14277                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14278 00001751 2E8816[8B17]            		mov	[cs:DRVLET], dl
 14279                                  		; 16/10/2022
 14280                                  		;;mov	byte [cs:drvlet], dl
 14281                                  		;mov	byte ptr cs:17E4h, dl ; [cs:drvlet]
 14282                                  					; 0070h:3D54h =	2C7h:17E4h
 14283 00001756 BE[6F17]                		mov	si, SNGMSG
 14284                                  		;mov	si, 17C8h	; sngmsg
 14285                                  					; 0070h:3D38h =	2C7h:17C8h
 14286 00001759 53                      		push	bx
 14287 0000175A 2E                      		cs
 14288 0000175B AC                      		lodsb			; get the next character of the message
 14289                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si]
 14290                                  wrmsg_loop:				
 14291 0000175C CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
 14292                                  					; AL = character to display
 14293 0000175E 2E                      		cs
 14294 0000175F AC                      		lodsb
 14295                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
 14296                                  					; get the next character of the	message
 14297 00001760 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14298 00001762 75F8                    		jnz	short wrmsg_loop
 14299 00001764 E8A0EA                  		call	con_flush	; flush out keyboard queue
 14300                                  					; call rom-bios
 14301 00001767 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14302 00001769 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
 14303                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
 14304 0000176B 5B                      		pop	bx
