 15566                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15567                                  
 15568                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15569                                  ;
 15570                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15571                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15572                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15573                                  ;
 15574                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15575                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15576                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15577                                  ;
 15578                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15579                                  
 15580                                  struc A_BPB
 15581 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15582 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15583 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15584 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15585 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1

 15859                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15860                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15861                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15862                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15863                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15864                                  									  
 15865                                  ;*******************************					  
 15866                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15867                                  ;*******************************					  
 15868                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15869                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15870                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15871                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15872                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15873                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15874                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15875                                  ;For all others:							  
 15876                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15877                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15878                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15879                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15880                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15881                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15882                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15883                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15884                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15885                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15886                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15887                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15888                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15889                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15890                                  ;									  
 15891                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15892                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15893                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15894                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15895                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15896                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15897                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15898                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15899                                  ;									  
 15900                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15901                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15902                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15903                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15904                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15905                                  ;									  
 15906                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15907                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15908                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15909                                  ;									  
 15910                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15911                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15912                                  ;									  
 15913                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15914                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15915                                  ;									  
 15916                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15917                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15918                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15919                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15920                                  ;						called. 		  
 15921                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15922                                  ;									  
 15923                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15924                                  ;									  
 15925                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15926                                  ;									  
 15927                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15928                                  ;									  
 15929                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15930                                  ;									  
 15931                                  
 15932                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15933                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15934 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15935 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15936                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15937 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15938 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15939 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15940 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15941                                  endstruc					  
 15942

 15944                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 15945                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 15946                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 15947                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 15948                                  					;;End of Modification

 16050                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16051                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16052                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16053                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16054                                  
 16055                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16056                                  ;
 16057                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16058                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16059                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16060                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16061                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16062                                  ;
 16063                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16064                                  ;
 16065                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16066                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16067                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16068                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16069                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16070                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16071                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16072                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16073                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16074                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16075                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16076                                  
 16077                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16078                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16079                                  
 16080                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16081                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16082 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16083 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16084 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16085 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16086 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16087 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16088                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16089 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16090 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16091 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16092                                  .size:
 16093                                  endstruc
 16094                                  
 16095                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16096                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16097                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16098                                  						; argument
 16099                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 16100                                  
 16101                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 16102                                  
 16103                                  ;Flag word masks
 16104                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16105                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 16106                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 16107                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 16108                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 16110                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16111                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16112                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16113                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16114                                  
 16115                                  ; system file table
 16116                                  
 16117                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16118                                  ;
 16119                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16120                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16121                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16122                                  
 16123                                  struc	SF
 16124 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16125 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16126 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16127                                  .size:
 16128                                  endstruc
 16129                                  
 16130                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16131                                  ;
 16132                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16133                                  
 16134                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16135 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16136                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16137 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16138 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16139 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16140                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16141                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16142                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16143                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16144                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16145                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16146                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16147                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16148                                  					;
 16149                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16150                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16151                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16152                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16153                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16154                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16155                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16156                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16157                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16158                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16159                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16160                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16161 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16162                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16163                                  					; points to net device header if
 16164                                  					; remote
 16165 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16166                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16167 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16168 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16169 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16170 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16171                                  ;
 16172                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16173                                  ; ID
 16174                                  ;
 16175 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16176 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16177 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 16178                                  ;
 16179                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 16180                                  ;
 16181 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 16182                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 16183                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 16184                                  					; disk changed errors.
 16185                                  ; SHARING INFO
 16186 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 16187 0000002D ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 16188 0000002F ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 16189 00000031 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 16190 00000033 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 16191 00000035 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 16192                                  .size:
 16193                                  endstruc

 16472                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16473                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16474                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16475                                  
 16476                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16477                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16478                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16479                                  
 16480                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16481                                  ;
 16482                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16483                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16484                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16485                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16486                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16487                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16488                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16489                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16490                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16491                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16492                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16493                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16494                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16495                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16496                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16497                                  ;
 16498                                  
 16499                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16500                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16501                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16502                                  ;
 16503                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16504                                  ;
 16505                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16506                                  ;
 16507                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16508                                  ;
 16509                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16510                                  ;
 16511                                  
 16512                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16513                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16514                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16515                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16516                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16517                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16518                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16519                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16520                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16521                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16522                                  
 16523                                  		;EVEN
 16524                                  ;align 2
 16525                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16526                                  
 16527 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16528 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16529 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16530 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16531 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16532 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16533                                  
 16534 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16535 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16536 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16537                                  
 16538                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16539                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16540                                  
 16541                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16542                                  
 16543 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16544                                  
 16545                                  int02:
 16546                                  
 16547                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16548                                  ;
 16549                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16550                                  ;
 16551                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16552                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16553                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16554                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16555                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16556                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16557                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16558                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16559                                  ;
 16560                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16561                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16562                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16563                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16564                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16565                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16566                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16567                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16568                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16569                                  ;
 16570                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16571                                  
 16572 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16573 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16574 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16575 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16576                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16577 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16578 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16579 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16580                                  
 16581 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16582                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16583                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16584                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16585                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16586 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16587 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16588                                  special02:
 16589 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16590 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 16591                                  normal02:
 16592 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 16593 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 16594 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 16822                                  ;********************************************************************
 16823                                  ;common routines
 16824                                  ;********************************************************************
 16825                                  
 16826                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16827                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16828                                  ; service routine
 16829                                  
 16830                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16831                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16832                                  
 16833                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16834                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16835                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16836                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16837                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16838                                  
 16839                                  do_int_stacks:
 16840 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16841 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16842 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16843 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16844 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16845 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16846                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16847                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16848                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16849 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16850 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16851 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16852                                  
 16853 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16854                                  
 16855                                  found02:
 16856 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16857 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16858                                  
 16859 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16860                                  
 16861 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16862                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16863                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16864                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16865                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16866 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16867 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16868                                  
 16869                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16870                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16871                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16872                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16873                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16874                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16875                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16876                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16877                                  
 16878                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16879 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16880 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16881 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16882 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16883 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16884 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16885 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16886 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16887                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16888                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16889 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16890                                  
 16891 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16892                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16893 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16894                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16895                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16896                                  
 16897 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16898                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16899 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16900                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16901                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16902 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16903 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16904                                  
 16905                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16906                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16907                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16908 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16909 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16910                                  
 16911 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16912 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16913 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16914 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16915 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16916                                  
 16917                                  notfree02:
 16918 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16919 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16920                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16921                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16922                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16923 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16924                                  
 16925                                  findnext02:
 16926 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16927 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16928                                  
 16929                                  foundbad02:
 16930 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16931 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16932 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16933                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16934                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16935                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16936 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16937 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16938                                  
 16939                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16940                                  
 16941                                  ; Common routines
 16942                                  
 16943                                  longpath:
 16944                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16945 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16946                                  lploopp:
 16947                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16948                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16949                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16950 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16951 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16952                                  
 16953 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16954                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16955                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16956                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16957 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16958 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16959 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16960                                  
 16961 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16962 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16963                                  
 16964                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16965                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16966                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16967 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16968                                  inuse:
 16969 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16970 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16971 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16972 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16973                                  found:
 16974 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16975                                  fatal:
 16976 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16977 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16978 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16979 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16980 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16981 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16982                                  
 16983 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16984 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16985                                  
 16986                                  skip_nmis:
 16987 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16988 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16989 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16990 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16991                                  
 16992 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16993 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16994 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg
 16995                                  ;SR;
 16996                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16997                                  ;
 16998 00000215 50                      	push	ax
 16999 00000216 1E                      	push	ds
 17000                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 17001                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 17002                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17003 00000217 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 17004 0000021A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17005                                  
 17006                                  	;test	byte [08D0h],1 	; (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:021Eh)
 17007 0000021C F606[CE08]01            	test	byte [IsWin386],1 ; (retrodos4.sys, offset: ****h)
 17008 00000221 1F                      	pop	ds
 17009 00000222 58                      	pop	ax
 17010 00000223 7405                    	jz	short fatal_loop	; win386 not present, continue
 17011                                  
 17012                                  	;;call	far ptr 0070h:08D1h ; (MSDOS 621, IO.SYS - SYSINIT:0227h)
 17013                                  	;call	KERNEL_SEGMENT:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; set focus to this VM
 17014                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17015 00000225 9A[CF08]7000            	call	DOSBIODATASEG:V86_Crit_SetFocus ; 0070h:08D1h
 17016                                  ;
 17017                                  ;SR; We do not bother about the returned status of this call. 
 17018                                  ;
 17019                                  fatal_loop:
 17020 0000022A AC                      	lodsb
 17021 0000022B 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 17022 0000022D 7408                    	je	short fatal_done
 17023                                  
 17024 0000022F B307                    	mov	bl,7
 17025 00000231 B40E                    	mov	ah,14
 17026 00000233 CD10                    	int	10h			; whoops, this enables ints
 17027 00000235 EBF3                    	jmp	short fatal_loop
 17028                                  
 17029                                  fatal_done:
 17030 00000237 EBFE                    	jmp	short fatal_done

 17361                                  ; set fake_floppy_drv if there is no diskette drives in this machine.

 17377                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
 17378                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one

 17381                                  ;

 18183                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18184                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18185                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18186                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18187                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18188                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18189                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18190                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18191                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18192                                  ;
 18193                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18194                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18195                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18196                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18197                                  ; been patched.
 18198

 18480                                  ;   which follow....)

 18482                                  retry:
 18483 000007D6 BA[C934]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 18484                                  
 18485                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18486                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18487                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18488                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18489                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18490                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18491                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18492                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 18493                                  
 18494                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 18495                                  
 18496 000007D9 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 18497 000007DA BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 18499 000007DF CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece

 18501 000007E3 CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 18502 000007E5 7243                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 18503                                  
 18504 000007E7 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18505 000007E9 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 18506 000007EB CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 18507 000007ED 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 18508                                  
 18509                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 18510                                  
 18511                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 18512                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 18513                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 18514                                  
 18515                                  	; 22/10/2022
 18516                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 18517 000007EF 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 18518 000007F3 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 18519                                  
 18520                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18521                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18522                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18523                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18524                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18525                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18526                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18527                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18528                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18529                                  ;
 18530                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18531                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18532                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18533                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18534                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18535                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18536                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 18537                                  
 18538                                  	; 22/10/2022

 18878                                  ;
 18879                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18880                                  ;
 18881                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18882                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18883                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18884                                  ;
 18885                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18886                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18887                                  ; 
 18888                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 18903                                  	; 11/12/2022

 18906                                  ;else
 18907                                  ;	..
 18908                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS

 18911                                  	; ds = cs

 18927                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18928                                  ;

 19279 00000965 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS

 19297                                  
 19298                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19299                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19300                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19301                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19302                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19303                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19304                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19305                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19306                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19307                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19308                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19309                                  ;
 19310                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19311                                  
 19312                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19313                                  update_arena:
 19314 0000097F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19315 00000980 57                      	push	di
 19316 00000981 51                      	push	cx
 19317 00000982 52                      	push	dx
 19318                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19319                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19320                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19321                                  	; ds = cs 
 19322 00000983 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19323 00000987 4F                      	dec	di
 19324 00000988 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19325                                  						;  before sysvar
 19326 00000989 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19327                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19328 0000098B 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19329 00000990 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19330 00000992 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19331                                  
 19332                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19333 00000994 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19334 00000999 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19335 0000099B 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19336 0000099D 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19337 0000099F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19338                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19339 000009A1 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19340                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19341 000009A5 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19342 000009AB 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19343                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19344 000009AD 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19345 000009B1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19346                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19347                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19348 000009B3 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19349 000009B6 5A                      	pop	dx
 19350 000009B7 59                      	pop	cx
 19351 000009B8 5F                      	pop	di
 19352 000009B9 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19353 000009BA C3                      	retn
 19354                                  ;
 19355                                  ; M012 : END
 19356                                  ;
 19357                                  FatalErr:
 19358 000009BB 0E                      	push	cs
 19359 000009BC 1F                      	pop	ds
 19360 000009BD BA[8608]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 19361 000009C0 B409                    	mov	ah,9

 19363                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 19364                                          ;jmp	stall

 19366 000009C4 FA                      	cli
 19367 000009C5 F4                      	hlt

 19371                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19372                                  
 19373                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19374                                  ;
 19375                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19376                                  ;
 19377                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19378                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19379                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19380                                  ;
 19381                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19382                                  ;
 19383                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19384                                  
 19385                                  AllocHMA:
 19386                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19387                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19388                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19389                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19390                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19391                                  
 19392                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19393                                  ;
 19394                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19395                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19396                                  ;	push	ax
 19397                                  ;	popf
 19398                                  ;	pushf
 19399                                  ;	pop	ax
 19400                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19401                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19402                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19403                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19404                                  
 19405                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19406                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)

 19544                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19545                                  ;
 19546                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19547                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19548                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19549                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19550                                  ;
 19551                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19552                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19553                                  ;
 19554                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19555                                  
 19556                                  StartVDHead:
 19557                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19558                                  
 19559 00000A3E 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19560 00000A42 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19561 00000A44 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19562 00000A46 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19563 00000A48 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19564                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19565 00000A49 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19566                                  VDiskSig1:
 19567 00000A50 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19568                                  
 19569                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19570                                  
 19571 00000A55 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19572                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19573 00000A5B 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19574 00000A6A 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19575 00000A6C 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19576                                  VDInt19:
 19577 00000A6D EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19578                                  OldVDInt19:
 19579 00000A6E 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19580                                  
 19581                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19582                                  
 19583                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19584 00000A72 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19585                                  VDiskSig2:
 19586 00000A75 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19587                                  
 19588                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19589                                  
 19590 00000A7A 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19591 00000A7D 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19592 00000A7F 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19593 00000A80 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19594 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19595 00000A83 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19596 00000A85 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19597 00000A87 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19598 00000A88 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19599 00000A8A 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19600 00000A8C 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19601 00000A8E 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19602 00000A90 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19603

 19607                                  ;
 19608                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19609                                  ;
 19610                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19611                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19612                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19613                                  ;
 19614                                  ; Inputs : None
 19615                                  ;
 19616                                  ; Outputs : None
 19617                                  ;
 19618                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19619                                  ;
 19620                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19621                                  
 19622                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19623                                  
 19624                                  InstVDiskHeader:

 19635                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19636 00000AA0 2EA3[700A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19637                                  
 19638                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19639                                  
 19640 00000AA4 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19641                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19642                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19643 00000AA6 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19644 00000AA9 CD21                    	int	21h
 19645                                  
 19646                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19647                                  
 19648 00000AAB 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19649 00000AAC 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19650                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19651 00000AAE 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19652                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19653 00000AB5 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19654 00000ABC 40                      	inc	ax
 19655 00000ABD 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19656                                  
 19657                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19658                                  
 19659 00000ABF FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19660                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)

 19740                                  
 19741                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19742                                  
 19743                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19744                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19745                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19746                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19747                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19748                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19749                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19750                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19751                                  ;								      ;I070
 19752                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19753                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19754                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19755                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19756                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19757                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19758                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19759                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19760                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19761                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19762                                  ;								      ;I070
 19763                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19764                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19765                                  
 19766                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19767                                  	; ds = cs
 19768

 19804                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19805                                  ;
 19806                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19807                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19808                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19809                                  ;		the offset.
 19810                                  ;
 19811                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19812                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19813                                  ;
 19814                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19815                                  
 19816                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:

 19818 00000B66 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19819 00000B69 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19820 00000B6B 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19821 00000B6E 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19822 00000B71 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19823 00000B73 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19824 00000B75 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19825 00000B77 1E                      	push	ds
 19826                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19827                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19828                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19829 00000B78 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19830 00000B7B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19831 00000B7D 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19832 00000B81 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19833 00000B86 1F                      	pop	ds
 19834 00000B87 C3                      	retn

 19878                                  ;		for CPM compatibility

 19883                                  CPMHack:

 19889 00000BB6 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 19890 00000BB7 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 19891 00000BB9 BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 19892 00000BBC BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h

 19894 00000BBF B105                    	mov	cl,5

 20762                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20763                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20764                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20765                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20766                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20767                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20768                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace

 21000                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21001                                  ;
 21002                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21003                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21004                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21005                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21006                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21007                                  ; program).

 21012                                  
 21013 00001039 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21014                                  
 21015                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21016                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21017                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21018                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21019                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21020                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21021                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21022                                  ; carridge return.
 21023                                  
 21024                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21025                                  ;character after =.
 21026

 21145                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21146                                  
 21147                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21148                                  ;
 21149                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21150                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21151                                  ;
 21152                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21153                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21154                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21155                                  
 21156                                  ParaRound:
 21157 000010B9 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21158 000010BC D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21159 000010BE D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21160 000010C0 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21161 000010C2 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21162 000010C4 C3                      	retn
 21163                                  
 21164                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21165                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21166                                  ;
 21167                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21168                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21169                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21170                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21171                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21172                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21173                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21174                                  ;
 21175                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21176                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21177                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21178                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21179                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21180                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21181                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21182                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21183                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21184                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21185                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21186                                  ;
 21187                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21188                                  
 21189                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21190                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21191                                  sysinit_base:				
 21192 000010C5 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21193 000010CA 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21194 000010CF CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21195 000010D1 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21196 000010D6 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21197 000010DB 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21198 000010DC 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21199 000010DD 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21200                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21201                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21202 000010DF E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21203 000010E2 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21204 000010E7 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21205                                  
 21206                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21207

 21209 000010EB 0E                      	push	cs
 21210 000010EC 1F                      	pop	ds

 21213                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21214                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"

 21217                                  	; 11/12/2022

 21220                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption

 21228                                  sum_up:
 21229                                  
 21230                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21231                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21232                                  ;
 21233                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21234                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21235                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21236                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21237                                  ;
 21238                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21239

 21241                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21242                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21244 000010FF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21245 00001101 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21246 00001103 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21247 00001105 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21248                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21249 0000110A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21250 0000110C 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21251                                  sum1:
 21252 0000110E 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21253 00001110 46                      	inc	si
 21254 00001111 46                      	inc	si
 21255 00001112 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21256                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21257                                  sum_sys_code:
 21258                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21259 00001114 BE1411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21260                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21261                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21262                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21263                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21264                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21265                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21266                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21267 00001117 B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21268 0000111A 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21269 0000111C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21270                                  sum2:
 21271 0000111E 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21272 00001121 46                      	inc	si
 21273 00001122 46                      	inc	si

 21275 00001125 1F                      	pop	ds
 21276 00001126 C3                      	retn

 21279
