 21299                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21300                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21301                                  ;
 21302                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21303                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21304                                  ;
 21305                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21306                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21307                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21308                                  ;
 21309                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21310                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21311                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21331 0000115B 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]

 21333

 21335

 21340

 21342

 21346 00001171 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21347                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21348                                  	; 25/10/2022

 21350                                  
 21351 00001177 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 21352 00001179 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21353                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21354 0000117B C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21355 0000117F 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21356                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21357 00001183 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21358                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21359 00001188 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21360 0000118B 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21361                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21362 0000118F 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21363                                  set_buff_2:
 21364 00001192 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax

 21366 00001197 2E800E[2E14]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 21368                                  	;retn
 21369                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21370 0000119D E91C1F                  	jmp	round

 21372                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21373                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21374                                  ;
 21375                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21376                                  ;
 21377                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21378                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21379                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 21381                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21382                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21383 000011A0 53                      	push	bx
 21384 000011A1 52                      	push	dx
 21385 000011A2 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21386 000011A6 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21387                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21388 000011AB 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21389                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21390                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21391                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21392 000011AE 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21393 000011B0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21394 000011B2 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21395                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21396 000011B5 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21397 000011B7 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21398 000011BA 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 21399 000011BC BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21400                                  	;zf=1
 21401                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21402                                  	;zf=1
 21403 000011BF 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21404                                  got_hma:
 21405 000011C4 5A                      	pop	dx
 21406 000011C5 5B                      	pop	bx
 21407 000011C6 C3                      	retn

 21432 000011E2 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 21437                                  ; ======================================================================
 21438                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21439                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21440                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21441                                  
 21442                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21443                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21444                                  ;
 21445                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21446                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21447                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21448                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21449                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21450                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21451                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21452                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21453                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21454                                  ;
 21455                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21456                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21457                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21458                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21459                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21460                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21461                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21462                                  ;	conditions:
 21463                                  ;
 21464                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21465                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21466                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21467                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21468                                  ;
 21469                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21470                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21471                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21472                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21473                                  ;
 21474                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21475                                  ;
 21476                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21477                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21478                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21479                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21480                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21481                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21482                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21483                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21484                                  ;
 21485                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21486                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21487                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21488                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21489                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21490                                  ;
 21491                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21492                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21493                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21494                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21495                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21496                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21497                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21498                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21499                                  ;
 21500                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21501                                  
 21502                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21503                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21504                                  
 21505                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21506                                  stackinit:
 21507 000011EF 50                      	push	ax
 21508 000011F0 1E                      	push	ds
 21509 000011F1 06                      	push	es
 21510 000011F2 53                      	push	bx
 21511 000011F3 51                      	push	cx
 21512 000011F4 52                      	push	dx
 21513 000011F5 57                      	push	di
 21514 000011F6 56                      	push	si
 21515 000011F7 55                      	push	bp
 21516                                  
 21517                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21518                                  
 21519                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21520                                  	; ds = cs
 21521 000011F8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21522 000011FB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21523                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21524                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21525                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21526 000011FD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21527                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 21529 00001204 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21530                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21531 00001208 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21532                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21533                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21534                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21535 0000120B 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21536                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21537 0000120F 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*

 21540                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21541                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21542 00001214 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax

 21545

 21547

 21549                                  	; 12/12/2022

 21552                                  
 21553                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21554                                  
 21555 0000121D B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21556                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21557                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21558                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21559 00001220 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21560 00001222 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21561 00001224 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21562 00001228 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21563 0000122A 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21564                                  
 21565                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21566                                  
 21567 0000122D 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21568 00001232 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21569 00001236 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21570 00001238 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21571 0000123A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21572 0000123C 06                      	push	es
 21573 0000123D 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21574                                  
 21575                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21576                                  
 21577 0000123E 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21578 00001242 FC                      	cld
 21579 00001243 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21580                                  
 21581 00001245 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21582                                  
 21583                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21584                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21585                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21586                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21587                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21588                                  
 21589                                  buildloop:

 21598 00001256 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 21599                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 21600 0000125A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 21601 0000125E 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 21602                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx

 21608 0000126A 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 21609 0000126D 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp

 21612 00001275 1E                      	push	ds
 21613 00001276 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 21614 00001279 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21615 0000127B 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ;convertible?

 21618

 21629                                  	;

 21631                                  	;mov	di,offset int19old&aa	;we have to set old&aa for int19 handler too.

 21644                                  stkinit_08:

 22242                                  int_77_not_first:
 22243                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22244                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22245                                  	;pop	ds
 22246 00001386 BF[8306]                	mov	di,INT19OLD77
 22247 00001389 BB[3101]                	mov	bx,old77
 22248 0000138C BA[2F01]                	mov	dx,int77
 22249 0000138F E85200                  	call	new_init_loop
 22250                                  
 22251                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22252                                  	;jmp	short int_77_end
 22253                                  ;int_77_first:
 22254                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22255                                  	;pop	ds
 22256                                  
 22257                                  int_77_end:
 22258 00001392 1E                      	push	ds
 22259 00001393 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; look at the model byte
 22260 00001396 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22261 00001398 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; pc convertible?
 22262 0000139D 1F                      	pop	ds
 22263 0000139E 7504                    	jne	short skip_enablenmis
 22264                                  
 22265 000013A0 B027                    	mov	al,27h			; enable convertible nmis
 22266 000013A2 E672                    	out	72h,al
 22267                                  
 22268                                  ; 25/10/2022
 22269                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT:15FBh)
 22270                                  
 22271                                  skip_enablenmis:

 22273                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22274                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22275                                  	; 21/10/2022

 22277 000013A8 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22278

 22280                                  
 22281 000013AA C606[4006]01            	mov	byte [INT19SEM],1	; indicate that int 19
 22282                                  					; initialization is complete
 22283

 22285 000013B0 5E                      	pop	si

 22302                                  int_xx_first_check:
 22303 000013B9 1E                      	push	ds

 22336                                  
 22337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22338                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22339                                  
 22340                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22341                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22342                                  
 22343                                  new_init_loop:
 22344                                  
 22345                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22346                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22347                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22348                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22349                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22350                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22351                                  
 22352 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22353 000013E7 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22354 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22355 000013ED 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22356                                  
 22357 000013F0 1E                      	push	ds
 22358                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22359                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22360                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22361 000013F1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22362 000013F4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22363 000013F6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22364 000013F9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22365 000013FB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22366 000013FF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22367 00001402 1F                      	pop	ds
 22368                                  
 22369 00001403 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22370 00001406 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22371 0000140A C3                      	retn
 22372                                  
 22373                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22374                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22375                                  
 22376                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22377                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22378                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22379                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22380                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22381                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22382                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22383                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22384                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22385                                  
 22386                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22387                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22388                                  
 22389                                  setdevmark:
 22390                                  
 22391 0000140B 06                      	push	es
 22392 0000140C 51                      	push	cx
 22393                                  
 22394 0000140D 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22395 00001412 2E890E[2C14]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22396 00001417 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22397                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22398                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22399 00001419 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22400 0000141D 41                      	inc	cx
 22401                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22402 0000141E 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22403                                  
 22404 00001423 59                      	pop	cx
 22405 00001424 07                      	pop	es
 22406 00001425 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22407 0000142A C3                      	retn

 22608                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22609                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22610                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22611                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22612                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22613                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 22615                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 22617                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22618

 22620                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22621 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22622 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22623 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22624                                  endstruc

 22635                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES

 22637                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22638                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES

 22640                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22641                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22642                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22643                                  
 22644                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22645                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22646 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22647 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22648 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22649                                  endstruc
 22650                                  
 22651                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22652                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22653                                  ;
 22654                                  ;
 22655                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22656                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22657                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22658                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22659                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22660                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22661                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22662                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22663                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22664                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22665                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22666                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22667                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22668                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22669                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22670                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22671                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22672                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22673                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22674                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22675                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22676                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22677                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22678                                  ;	   :
 22679                                  ;
 22680                                  ;Note:
 22681                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22682                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22683                                  ;
 22684                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22685                                  ;
 22686                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22687                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22688                                  ;
 22689                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22690                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22691                                  ;
 22692                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22693                                  ;
 22694                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22695                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22696                                  ;
 22697                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22698                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22699                                  ;
 22700                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22701                                  ;
 22702                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22703                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22704                                  ;
 22705                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22706                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22707                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22708                                  ;
 22709                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22710                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22711                                  ;
 22712                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22713                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22714                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22715                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22716                                  
 22717                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22718                                  
 22719                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22720                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22721                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22722                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22723                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22724                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22725                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22726                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22727                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22728                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22729                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22730                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22731                                  
 22732                                  ;**** Function flags
 22733                                  
 22734                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22735                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22736                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22737                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22738                                  
 22739                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22740                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22741 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22742 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22743 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22744 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22745 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22746 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22747                                  endstruc
 22748                                  
 22749                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22750                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22751                                  ;
 22752                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22753                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22754                                  ;	     +-
 22755                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22756                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22757                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22758                                  ;	     |	:
 22759                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22760                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22761                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22762                                  ;	     |	:
 22763                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22764                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22765                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22766                                  ;	     +-	:
 22767                                  ;
 22768                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22769                                  ;
 22770                                  ;Note:
 22771                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22772                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22773                                  ;
 22774                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22775                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22776                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22777                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22778                                  
 22779                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22780                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22781                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22782                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22783                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22784                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22785                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22786                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22787                                  
 22788                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22789 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22790 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22791 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22792 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22793 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22794                                  endstruc
 22795                                  
 22796                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22797                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22798                                  ;
 22799                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22800                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22801                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22802                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22803                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22804                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22805                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22806                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22807                                  ;
 22808                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22809                                  ;
 22810                                  ;            +-
 22811                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22812                                  ;	    | or
 22813                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22814                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22815                                  ;	    | or
 22816                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22817                                  ;	    | or
 22818                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22819                                  ;	    | or
 22820                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22821                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22822                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22823                                  ;	    | or
 22824                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22825                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22826                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22827                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22828                                  ;	    +-
 22829                                  ;
 22830                                  ;
 22831                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22832                                  ;      list.
 22833                                  ;
 22834                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22835                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22836                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22837                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22838                                  
 22839                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22840                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22841 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22842 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22843 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22844 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22845                                  endstruc
 22846

 22849

 22852                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22853                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22854                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22855                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22856                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22857                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22858                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22859                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 22860

 22862

 22868                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 22869                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 22870                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 22871                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 22872                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 22873                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22874                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22875                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22876                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22958                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22959                                  
 22960                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22961                                  ; SysParse;
 22962                                  ;
 22963                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22964                                  ;
 22965                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22966                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22967                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22968                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22969                                  ;
 22970                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22971                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22972                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22973                                  ;
 22974                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22975                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22976                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22977                                  ;
 22978                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22979                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22980                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22981                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22982                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22983                                  ;
 22984                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22985                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22986                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22987                                  ;
 22988                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22989                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22990                                  ;
 22991                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22992                                  ;
 22993                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22994                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22995                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22996                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22997                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22998                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22999                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23000                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23001                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23002                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23003                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23004                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23005                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23006                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23007                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23008                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23009                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)

 23012                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23013                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)

 23023

 23025

 23027                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23028                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23029                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.

 23032                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23033                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a

 23035                                  ;

 23038                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23039                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23040                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23041                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23042                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23043                                  
 23044                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23045                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23046                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23047                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23048                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23049                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23050                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23051                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23052                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23053

 23055                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23056                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other

 23164                                  ;M029 -- Begin changes
 23165                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 23166                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 23167                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 23168                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 23169                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 23170                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23171

 23175 00001509 2EC706[D314]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23176 00001510 2EC706[D514]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='

 23585                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23586                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23587                                  ;
 23588                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23589                                  ;
 23590                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23591                                  ;	    AL = type
 23592                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23593                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23594                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23595                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23596                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23597                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23598                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23599                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23600                                  ;
 23601                                  ; Output:   None
 23602                                  ;
 23603                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23604                                  ;

 23606                                  ;***********************************************************************

 23809                                  ;

 23811                                  ;
 23812                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed

 23824 0000184E 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?

 23834 00001861 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.

 23838 00001866 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.

 23850                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23851                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 23852                                  ;
 23853                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23854                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23855                                  ;
 23856                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 23857                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 23858                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 23859                                  ;
 23860                                  ; Output:   None
 23861                                  ;
 23862                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23863                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23864                                  
 23865                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 23866 0000186F 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23867 00001870 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23868 00001871 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 23869                                  
 23870                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 23871 00001873 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 23872 00001876 E82D04                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 23873 00001879 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 23874                                  
 23875 0000187B 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23876 0000187D 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 23877                                  
 23878 0000187F E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 23879 00001882 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 23880 00001885 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 23881                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 23882 00001887 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 23883                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 23884 00001888 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 23885 00001889 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 23886                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 23887 0000188B 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 23888 0000188C 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23889 0000188D C3                      	retn
 23890                                  
 23891                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23892                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 23893                                  ;
 23894                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23895                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23896                                  ;
 23897                                  ; Input:    DL = 2 : Use character table
 23898                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table
 23899                                  ;	    AL = character to be capitalized
 23900                                  ;
 23901                                  ; Output:   None
 23902                                  ;
 23903                                  ; Use:	INT 21h /w AH=65h
 23904                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23905                                  
 23906                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_Char:
 23907 0000188E 3C80                    	cmp	al,_$P_ASCII80	;80h	;AN000; need upper case table ?
 23908 00001890 730C                    	jae	short _$P_DCC_Go	;AN000;
 23909                                  
 23910 00001892 3C61                    	cmp	al,"a"                  ;AN000; if no,
 23911 00001894 7238                    	jb	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   check if  "a" <= AL <= "z"
 23912                                  
 23913 00001896 3C7A                    	cmp	al,"z"                  ;AN000;
 23914 00001898 7734                    	ja	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   if yes, make CAPS
 23915                                  
 23916 0000189A 24DF                    	and	al,_$P_Make_Upper ;0DFh ;AN000;   else do nothing.
 23917 0000189C EB30                    	jmp	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;
 23918                                  
 23919                                  _$P_DCC_Go:				;AN000;
 23920 0000189E 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 23921 0000189F 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 23922 000018A0 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23923                                  
 23924                                  	;lea	di,[cs:_$P_Char_CAP_Ptr] ;AC034; or use char CAPS table ?
 23925 000018A1 8D3E[CA14]              	lea	di,[_$P_Char_CAP_Ptr]
 23926                                  _$P_DCC00:				;AN000;
 23927 000018A5 2E3815                  	cmp	[cs:di],dl		;AN000; already got table address ?
 23928 000018A8 7417                    	je	short _$P_DCC01		;AN000; if no,
 23929                                  
 23930                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used to pass a 5 byte workarea to INT 21h,
 23931                                  ; the GET COUNTYRY INFO call. This usage of ES is required by the function
 23932                                  ; call, regardless of what base register is currently be defined as cs.
 23933                                  
 23934 000018AA 50                      	push	ax			;AN000; get CAPS table thru DOS call
 23935 000018AB 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23936 000018AC 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23937                                  
 23938 000018AD 0E                      	push	cs			;AC036; pass current base seg into
 23939                                  					;(Note: this used to push CS.  BUG...
 23940 000018AE 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;   ES reg, required for
 23941                                  					;get extended country information
 23942 000018AF B465                    	mov	ah,_$P_DOS_Get_TBL	;AN000; get extended CDI
 23943 000018B1 88D0                    	mov	al,dl			;AN000; upper case table
 23944 000018B3 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,_$P_DOSTBL_Def	;AN000; get active CON
 23945 000018B6 B90500                  	mov	cx,_$P_DOSTBL_BL 	;AN000; buffer length
 23946 000018B9 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,_$P_DOSTBL_Def	;AN000; get for default code page
 23947                                  					;DI already set to point to buffer
 23948 000018BC CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000; es:di point to buffer that
 23949                                  					;now has been filled in with info
 23950 000018BE 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 23951 000018BF 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 23952 000018C0 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23953                                  
 23954                                  _$P_DCC01:				;AN000;
 23955                                  
 23956                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used as the base of the XLAT table, provided
 23957                                  ; by the previous GET COUNTRY INFO DOS call.  This usage of ES is made
 23958                                  ; regardless of which base reg is currently the cs reg.
 23959                                  
 23960                                  	; 28/09/2023
 23961                                  	;mov	bx,[cs:di+_$P_DOS_TBL.Off] ;AN000; get offset of table
 23962                                  	;mov	es,[cs:di+_$P_DOS_TBL.Seg] ;AN000; get segment of table
 23963                                  	; 07/07/2023
 23964 000018C1 2EC45D01                	les	bx,[cs:di+_$P_DOS_TBL.Off]
 23965 000018C5 43                      	inc	bx			;AC035; add '2' to
 23966 000018C6 43                      	inc	bx			;AC035;  BX reg
 23967                                  					;AN000; skip length field
 23968 000018C7 2C80                    	sub	al,_$P_ASCII80 ; 80h	;AN000; make char to index
 23969                                  	;xlat	es:[bx] 		;AN000; perform case map
 23970 000018C9 26                      	es
 23971 000018CA D7                      	xlat
 23972 000018CB 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 23973 000018CC 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 23974 000018CD 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 23975                                  _$P_CAPS_Ret:				;AN000;
 23976 000018CE C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 23978                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23979                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23980                                  ;
 23981                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23982                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23983                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23984                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23985                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23986                                  ;
 23987                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23988                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23989                                  ;
 23990                                  ; Output:    None
 23991                                  ;
 23992                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23993                                  ;
 23994                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23995                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23996                                  
 23997                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23998                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23999                                  
 24000                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24001 000018CF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24002 000018D0 2E800E[4114]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 24003 000018D6 2E8026[4114]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 24004 000018DC 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 24005 000018DF 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24006 000018E1 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24007                                  
 24008 000018E3 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 24009 000018E5 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 24010                                  
 24011 000018E7 2E800E[4114]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24012                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24013 000018ED 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24014                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24015 000018EE E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24016 000018F1 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24017 000018F2 C3                      	retn
 24018                                  
 24019                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24020                                  
 24021                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24022                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 24023 000018F3 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24024 000018F4 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24025 000018F5 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24026 000018F6 56                      	push	si			;AN000;

 24028 000018F9 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 24029 000018FB 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 24030                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;

 24032 000018FF 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?

 24036 00001906 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 24037                                  
 24038 00001908 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 24039 0000190A 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 24040 0000190C D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 24041 0000190E D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24042 00001910 E8D100                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24043 00001913 722C                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24044                                  
 24045 00001915 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 24046 00001917 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 24047 00001919 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 24048 0000191B D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24049 0000191D E8C400                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24050 00001920 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24051                                  
 24052 00001922 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 24053 00001924 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 24054 00001926 E8BB00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24055 00001929 7216                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24056

 24058 0000192D 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 24059 0000192F E8B200                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?

 24061                                  
 24062 00001934 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 24063 00001936 83D100                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 24064 00001939 E8A800                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 24065 0000193C 7203                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 24066                                  
 24067 0000193E 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 24068 0000193F EBBB                    	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 24069                                  ;
 24070                                  _$P_Value_Err0:				;AN000;
 24071 00001941 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24072 00001942 E98C00                  	jmp	_$P_Value_Err		;AN000; Bridge
 24073                                  ;
 24074                                  _$P_Value00:				;AN000;
 24075 00001945 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; restore control pointer
 24076 00001946 2EF606[4114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; here cx,dx = 32bit value

 24078

 24212                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24213                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24214                                  ;
 24215                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24216                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24217                                  ;
 24218                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24219                                  ;
 24220                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24221                                  ;
 24222                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24223                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24224                                  
 24225                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24226                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24227 000019E4 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24228 000019E5 2EF606[4114]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24229 000019EB 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24230                                  
 24231 000019ED 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24232 000019EE C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24233                                  
 24234                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24235 000019EF 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24236 000019F0 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24237

 24916                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24917                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24918                                  ;
 24919                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24920                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24921                                  ;
 24922                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24923                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24924                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24925                                  ;
 24926                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24927                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24928                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24929                                  
 24930                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24931                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24932                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24933                                  ;
 24934                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24935                                  
 24936                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24937                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24938                                  
 24939                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24940                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24941 00001C8C 8D2E[4A14]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24942                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24943 00001C90 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24944 00001C92 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24945                                  
 24946                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24947 00001C94 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24948 00001C96 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24949                                  
 24950 00001C98 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24951                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24952                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24953 00001C99 C3                      	retn
 24954                                  
 24955                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24956                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24957                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24958                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24959                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24960                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24961                                  
 24962                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24963                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24964 00001C9A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24965 00001C9C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24966                                  
 24967 00001C9E 2E800E[4114]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24968                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24969                                  
 24970                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24971                                  	; cf=0
 24972                                  	;retn
 24973                                  
 24974                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24975                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24976                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24977 00001CA4 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24978                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24979                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24980 00001CA5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25006 00001CB1 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25007 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25008 00001CB3 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25009 00001CB4 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25010 00001CB5 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25011 00001CB6 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25012 00001CB7 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25013 00001CB8 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25014 00001CBA 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 25015 00001CBC B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25016 00001CBF CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25017                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25018 00001CC1 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25019 00001CC3 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25020 00001CC5 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25021 00001CC6 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25022 00001CC7 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25023 00001CC8 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25024 00001CC9 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25025 00001CCA 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25026 00001CCB 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25027 00001CCC 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25028                                  
 25029                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25030 00001CCE 2E8936[3C14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25031 00001CD3 2E891E[3E14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25032                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25033 00001CD8 2E8B36[3C14]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25034 00001CDD 2E8E1E[3E14]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25035                                  
 25036                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25037 00001CE2 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25038 00001CE5 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25039                                  
 25040 00001CE7 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25041 00001CE9 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25042                                  
 25043 00001CEB 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25044 00001CEE 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25045                                  
 25046 00001CF0 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25047 00001CF1 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25048                                  
 25049                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25050 00001CF3 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25051 00001CF4 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25052                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25053 00001CF5 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25054                                  
 25055                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25056                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25057                                  	; cf=0
 25058                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25059                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25060 00001CF7 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25061 00001CF8 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25062 00001CF9 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25063 00001CFA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
