 25074                                  
 25075                                  struc p_parms
 25076 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 25077 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 25078 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 25079 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 25080                                  .size:
 25081                                  endstruc
 25082                                  
 25083                                  struc p_pos
 25084 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 25085 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 25086 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 25087                                  
 25088                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 25089                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 25090                                  
 25091 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 25092 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 25093                                  .size:
 25094                                  endstruc
 25095                                  
 25096                                  struc	p_range
 25097 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 25098 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 25099 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 25100 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 25101 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 25102                                  .size:
 25103                                  endstruc

 25617                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25618                                  
 25619                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25620                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25621                                  
 25622                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25623                                  ;
 25624                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25625                                  ;
 25626                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25627                                  ;
 25628                                  ;   Modification log:
 25629                                  ;
 25630                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25631                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25632                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25633                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25634                                  ;
 25635                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25636                                  ;
 25637                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25638                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25639                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25640                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25641                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25642                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25643                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25644                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25645                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25646                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25647                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25648                                  ;
 25649                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25650                                  
 25651                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25652                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25653                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25654                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25655                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25656                                  
 25657                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25658                                  
 25659                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25660                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25661                                  
 25662                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25663                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25664                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25665                                  
 25666                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25667                                  ;
 25668                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25669                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25670                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25671                                  ;	           line.
 25672                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25673                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25674                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25675                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25676                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25677                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25678                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25679                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25680                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25681                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25682                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25683                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25684                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25685                                  ;	           for details).
 25686                                  
 25687                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25688                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25689                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25690                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25691                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25692                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25693                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25694                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25695                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25696                                  
 25697                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25698                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25699                                  
 25700                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25701                                  
 25702                                  %endif
 25703

 25717 00001EE4 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver

 25757                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25758                                  ;
 25759                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25760                                  ;
 25761                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25762                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25763                                  ;
 25764                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25765                                  
 25766                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25767                                  doconf:
 25768 00001F11 0E                      	push	cs
 25769 00001F12 1F                      	pop	ds
 25770                                  
 25771 00001F13 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25772                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25773 00001F16 CD21                    	int	21h
 25774 00001F18 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25775                                  
 25776                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25777                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25778                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25779                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25780                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25781                                  
 25782 00001F1C BA[7034]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25783 00001F1F B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25784                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25785 00001F22 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25786 00001F23 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25787 00001F25 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25788                                  
 25789                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25790                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25791                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25792                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25793                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25794 00001F27 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25795 00001F2C C3                      	retn
 25796                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25797 00001F2D 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25798 00001F2F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25799 00001F31 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25800                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25801 00001F33 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25802 00001F36 CD21                    	int	21h
 25803 00001F38 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 25804                                  
 25805 00001F3B 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25806                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25807 00001F3D B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25808 00001F40 CD21                    	int	21h
 25809                                  
 25810                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25811                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25812 00001F42 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25813                                  
 25814 00001F46 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25815 00001F49 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25816 00001F4C E86AF1                  	call	ParaRound
 25817 00001F4F 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25818                                  
 25819                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25820                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25821                                  ;;
 25822                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25823                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25824                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25825                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25826                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25827                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25828                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25829                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25830                                  ;;
 25831                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25832                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25833                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25834                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25835                                  
 25836 00001F51 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25837                                  	
 25838                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25839                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25840                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25841 00001F54 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25842 00001F58 E874EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 25843                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25844                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25845 00001F5B 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25846                                   
 25847 00001F60 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25848 00001F62 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25849                                  
 25850 00001F64 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25851 00001F66 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25852 00001F6B B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25853                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25854 00001F6D F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25855 00001F6E CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25856 00001F70 9C                      	pushf
 25857                                  
 25858                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25859                                  
 25860 00001F71 50                      	push	ax
 25861 00001F72 57                      	push	di
 25862 00001F73 51                      	push	cx
 25863 00001F74 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25864 00001F76 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25865 00001F78 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25866 00001F7A F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25867 00001F7C 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25868                                  
 25869                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25870                                  
 25871 00001F7E 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25872                                  
 25873                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25874                                  
 25875                                  puteol:
 25876 00001F7F B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25877 00001F81 AA                      	stosb
 25878 00001F82 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25879 00001F84 AA                      	stosb
 25880 00001F85 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25881                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25882                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25883                                  
 25884                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25885                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25886 00001F87 0E                      	push	cs
 25887 00001F88 1F                      	pop	ds
 25888                                  
 25889 00001F89 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25890                                  
 25891 00001F8D 59                      	pop	cx
 25892 00001F8E 5F                      	pop	di
 25893 00001F8F 58                      	pop	ax
 25894                                  
 25895                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25896                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25897                                  	;push	cs
 25898                                  	;pop	ds
 25899                                  
 25900 00001F90 50                      	push	ax
 25901                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25902 00001F91 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25903 00001F93 CD21                    	int	21h
 25904 00001F95 58                      	pop	ax
 25905 00001F96 9D                      	popf
 25906 00001F97 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25907 00001F99 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25908 00001F9B 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25909                                  conferr:
 25910 00001F9D BA[7034]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25911 00001FA0 E8AC13                  	call	badfil
 25912                                  endconv:
 25913 00001FA3 C3                      	retn
 25914                                  
 25915                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25916                                  ;
 25917                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25918                                  ;
 25919                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25920                                  ;

 25922                                  
 25923                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25924                                  multi_pass:
 25925 00001FA4 0E                      	push	cs
 25926 00001FA5 1F                      	pop	ds
 25927                                  
 25928 00001FA6 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25929                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25930 00001FAB 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25931                                  
 25932                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25933                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25934 00001FAD FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25935 00001FB1 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25936                                  
 25937 00001FB2 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25938 00001FB6 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25939 00001FBA 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25940 00001FBC 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25941 00001FC0 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25942                                  
 25943 00001FC4 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25944 00001FC7 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25945                                  
 25946                                  getcom:
 25947 00001FC9 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25948 00001FCC E86007                  	call	getchr
 25949                                  conflp: 
 25950 00001FCF 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25951                                  
 25952 00001FD1 FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25953                                  
 25954 00001FD5 C606[2B14]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.

 25956 00001FDF 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25957 00001FE1 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25958                                  
 25959                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25960                                  %if 0
 25961                                  
 25962                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25963                                  
 25964                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25965                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25966                                  
 25967                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25968                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25969                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25970                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25971                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25972                                  
 25973                                          push    ax                      ;
 25974                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25975                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25976                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25977                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25978                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25979                                          pop     ax
 25980                                  ;
 25981                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25982                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25983                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25984                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25985                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25986                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25987                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25988                                  ;   spot.
 25989                                  ;
 25990                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25991                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25992                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25993                                  ;   retrieved.
 25994                                  ;
 25995                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25996                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25997                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25998                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25999                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26000                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26001                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26002                                  final:                                  ;
 26003                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26004                                  not_final:                              ;
 26005                                  ;endif
 26006                                  
 26007                                  %endif
 26008 00001FE3 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26009 00001FE5 E84707                  	call	getchr
 26010 00001FE8 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26011                                  
 26012 00001FEA 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2

 26014                                  	; 27/10/2022

 26016 00001FF1 E90707                  	jmp	badop
 26017

 26020                                  	; ds = cs
 26021                                  	;push	cs
 26022                                  	;pop	ds

 26034                                  	;push	cs

 26037                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.

 26105                                  ;;endif

 26111                                  %if 0

 26115                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26116                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 26119                                  ;endif

 26121                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26122                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26123

 26126                                  	mov	bx,ax

 26128                                  
 26129                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst

 26132                                  
 26133                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26134                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26135                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26136                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26137                                  
 26138                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26139                                  	mov	bx,1
 26140                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26141                                  
 26142                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26143                                  
 26144                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26145                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26146                                          int     21h
 26147                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26148                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26149                                          int     21h
 26150                                  
 26151                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26152                                  
 26153                                  %endif

 26174                                  
 26175                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26176                                  ;									      *
 26177                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26178                                  ;									      *
 26179                                  ; input :								      *
 26180                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26181                                  ; output:								      *
 26182                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26183                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26184                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26185                                  ;									      *
 26186                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26187                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26188                                  ; logic:								      *
 26189                                  ; {									      *
 26190                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26191                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26192                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26193                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26194                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26195                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26196                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26197                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26198                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26199                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26200                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26201                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26202                                  ;	};								      *
 26203                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26204                                  ; };									      *
 26205                                  ;									      *
 26206                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26207                                  
 26208                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26209                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26210                                  tryb:
 26211 0000204A 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26212 0000204D 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26213                                  
 26214                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26215                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26216                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26217                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26218                                  ;;endif
 26219

 26221                                  	; 18/12/2022

 26224 00002051 880E[421D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26225

 26227                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26228                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26229                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26230                                  do7:
 26231 00002058 E87D06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26232 0000205B 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26233                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26234                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26235                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26236                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26237                                  ;sr7:
 26238                                  	;jmp	coff
 26239                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26240 0000205D E9F605                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26241                                  if7:
 26242 00002060 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 26243 00002063 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 26244                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26245 00002065 813E[461D][3B1D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x

 26294                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26295                                  ; break command
 26296                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26297                                  
 26298                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26299                                  ;									    *
 26300                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26301                                  ;									    *
 26302                                  ; input :								    *
 26303                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26304                                  ; output:								    *
 26305                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26306                                  ;									    *
 26307                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26308                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26309                                  ; logic:								    *
 26310                                  ; {									    *
 26311                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26312                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26313                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26314                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26315                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26316                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26317                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26318                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26319                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26320                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26321                                  ;	};								    *
 26322                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26323                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 26324                                  ; };									    *
 26325                                  ;									    *
 26326                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26327                                  
 26328                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26329                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 26330                                  tryc:
 26331 000020A6 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 26332 000020A9 7534                    	jne	short trym
 26333                                  
 26334                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26335                                  ;;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 26336                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26337                                  ;       jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26338                                  ;;endif
 26339 000020AB BF[4C1D]                	mov	di,brk_parms
 26340 000020AE 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26341                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26342                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26343                                  do22:
 26344 000020B0 E82506                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26345 000020B3 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 26346                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 26347                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 26348                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26349                                  ;sr22:
 26350                                  	;jmp	coff
 26351                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26352 000020B5 E99E05                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26353                                  if22:
 26354 000020B8 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL		; end of line?
 26355 000020BB 7415                    	je	short en22		; then end the $endloop
 26356                                  
 26357                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 26358 000020BD 803E[451D]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1
 26359 000020C2 7507                    	jne	short if26
 26360                                  
 26361 000020C4 C606[711D]01            	mov	byte [p_ctrl_break],1	; turn it on
 26362                                  	;jmp	short en26
 26363                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26364 000020C9 EBE5                    	jmp	short do22

 26369                                  en22:
 26370 000020D2 B433                    	mov	ah,SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING ; if we don't have any parse error.
 26371 000020D4 B001                    	mov	al,1
 26372 000020D6 8A16[711D]              	mov	dl,[p_ctrl_break]

 26374                                  	; 31/12/2022

 26380                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26381                                  ; multitrack command
 26382                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26383                                  
 26384                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26385                                  ;									      *
 26386                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 26387                                  ;									      *
 26388                                  ; input :								      *
 26389                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26390                                  ; output:								      *
 26391                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 26392                                  ;									      *
 26393                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26394                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26395                                  ; logic:								      *
 26396                                  ; {									      *
 26397                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 26398                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26399                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26400                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26401                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26402                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 26403                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 26404                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 26405                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 26406                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 26407                                  ;	};								      *
 26408                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 26409                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *

 26413                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26414                                  
 26415                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 26421                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26422                                  ;       call    query_user      ; query the user if config_cmd
 26423                                  ;       jc      short tryu	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26424                                  ;;endif
 26425 000020E4 BF[501E]                	mov	di,mtrk_parms
 26426 000020E7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26427                                  	; 04/01/2023

 27721                                  
 27722                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27723                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27724                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27725                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27726                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27727                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27728                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27729                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27730                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27731                                  
 27732                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27733                                  ;									  *
 27734                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27735                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27736                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27737                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27738                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27739                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27740                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27741                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27742                                  ; input :								  *
 27743                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27744                                  ; output:								  *
 27745                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27746                                  ;									  *
 27747                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27748                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27749                                  ; logic:								  *
 27750                                  ; {									  *
 27751                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27752                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27753                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27754                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27755                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27756                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27757                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27758                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27759                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27760                                  ;	     }								  *
 27761                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27762                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27763                                  ;	};								  *
 27764                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27765                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27766                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27767                                  ; };									  *
 27768                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27769                                  
 27770                                  tryk:
 27771                                          ;if      stacksw
 27772

 28437                                  sysinit_parse:
 28438                                  
 28439                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28440                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28441                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28442                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28443                                  ;
 28444                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28445                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28446                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28447                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28448                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28449                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28450                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28451                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28452                                  ;	 procedure.
 28453                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28454                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28455                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28456                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28457                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28458                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28459                                  
 28460                                  	; 24/10/2022

 28671                                  ; procedure : showlinenum
 28672                                  ;
 28673                                  ; convert the binary linecount to decimal ascii string in showcount
 28674                                  ; and display showcount at the current curser position.
 28675                                  ; in.) linecount
 28676                                  ;
 28677                                  ; out) the number is printed.
 28678                                  ;

 28689

 28691 0000274F 07                      	pop	es		; es=cs
 28692

 28694                                  	;push	cs
 28695                                  	;pop	ds
 28696                                  
 28697 00002750 BF[3103]                	mov	di,showcount+4	; di -> the least significant decimal field.
 28698 00002753 B90A00                  	mov	cx,10		; decimal divide factor
 28699                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:linecount]
 28700                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28701 00002756 A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 28702                                  sln_loop:
 28703                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28704 00002759 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; < 10 ?
 28705                                  	;cmp	ax,10		; < 10?
 28706 0000275B 720C                    	jb	short sln_last
 28707                                  
 28708 0000275D 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 28709 0000275F F7F1                    	div	cx	; cx = 10
 28710 00002761 80CA30                  	or	dl,30h		; add "0" (= 30h) to make it an ascii.
 28711 00002764 8815                    	mov	[di],dl
 28712 00002766 4F                      	dec	di
 28713 00002767 EBF0                    	jmp	short sln_loop
 28714                                  
 28715                                  sln_last:

 28717 0000276B 8805                    	mov	[di],al
 28718 0000276D 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28719 0000276F E8090C                  	call	print		; show it.
 28720 00002772 5F                      	pop	di
 28721                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28722                                  	;pop	ds
 28723 00002773 07                      	pop	es

 28782                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28783                                  ;
 28784                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28785                                  ;
 28786                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28787                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28788                                  ;
 28789                                  ;	Output : none
 28790                                  ;
 28791                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28792                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28793                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28794                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28795                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28796                                  ;
 28797                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28798                                  
 28799                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28800                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28801                                  	; ds = cs
 28802 00002798 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28803                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28804                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28805 0000279B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28806 0000279E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28807                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28808                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28809                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28810                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28811                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28812                                  	; ds = cs
 28813 000027A0 803E[FB1E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28814 000027A5 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28815 000027A7 A1[E21E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28816                                  lim_set:
 28817                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28818                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28819                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28820                                  ;limx:
 28821                                  	;retn
 28822                                  	
 28823                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28824                                  
 28825                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28826                                  ;
 28827                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28828                                  ;
 28829                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28830                                  ;	Output : none
 28831                                  ;
 28832                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28833                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28834                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28835                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28836                                  ;
 28837                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28838                                  
 28839                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28840                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28841 000027AA 1E                      	push	ds
 28842 000027AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28843 000027AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28844 000027B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28845 000027B4 2E891E[FF1E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28846 000027B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28847 000027BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28848 000027BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28849 000027C0 2EC606[FE1E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28850 000027C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 28851                                  ;limx:
 28852 000027C7 C3                      	retn
 28853                                  
 28854                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28855                                  ;
 28856                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28857                                  ;
 28858                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28859                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28860                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28861                                  ;
 28862                                  ;	Output : none
 28863                                  ;
 28864                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28865                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28866                                  ;
 28867                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28868                                  
 28869                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28870                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28871                                  	; ds = cs
 28872 000027C8 803E[FE1E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28873                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28874                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28875                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28876 000027CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28877                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28878 000027CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28879 000027D2 8826[FE1E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28880                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28881                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28882 000027D6 1E                      	push	ds
 28883                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28884 000027D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28885 000027D9 2EA1[FF1E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28886 000027DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28887 000027E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 28888                                  timx:
 28889 000027E1 C3                      	retn
 28890                                  
 28891                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28892                                  ;
 28893                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 28894                                  ;
 28895                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 28896                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 28897                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 28898                                  ;
 28899                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28900                                  
 28901                                  IsIt3Com:
 28902                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28903                                  	; ds = cs
 28904 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28905 000027E3 06                      	push	es
 28906 000027E4 56                      	push	si
 28907                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28908 000027E5 C536[E41E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 28909                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 28910 000027E9 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 28911 000027EC 0E                      	push	cs
 28912 000027ED 07                      	pop	es
 28913 000027EE BF[011F]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 28914 000027F1 B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 28915 000027F4 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 28916 000027F6 5E                      	pop	si
 28917 000027F7 07                      	pop	es
 28918 000027F8 1F                      	pop	ds
 28919 000027F9 C3                      	retn
 28920                                  
 28921                                  ;M020 : BEGIN
 28922                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28923                                  
 28924                                  UpdatePDB:
 28925 000027FA 1E                      	push	ds
 28926 000027FB B462                    	mov	ah,62h
 28927 000027FD CD21                    	int	21h	; DOS - 3+ - GET PSP ADDRESS
 28928 000027FF 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 28929 00002801 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 28930                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 28931 00002806 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 28932 0000280A 1F                      	pop	ds
 28933 0000280B C3                      	retn
 28934                                  
 28935                                  ; M020 : END
 28936

 28938                                  
 28939                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28940                                  
 28941                                  %if 0
 28942                                  
 28943                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28944                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28945                                  
 28946                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28947                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28948                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28949                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28950                                  
 28951                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28952                                  ;
 28953                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28954                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28955                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28956                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28957                                  ;
 28958                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28959                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28960                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28961                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28962                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28963                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28964                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28965                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28966                                  ; available during the load.
 28967                                  ;
 28968                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28969                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28970                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28971                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28972                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28973                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28974                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28975                                  ;
 28976                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28977                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28978                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28979                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28980                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28981                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28982                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28983                                  ;
 28984                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28985                                  
 28986                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28987                                  
 28988                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28989                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28990                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28991                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28992                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28993                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28994                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28995                                  
 28996                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28997                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28998                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28999                                  
 29000                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29001                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29002                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29003                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29004                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29005                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29006                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29007                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29008                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29009                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29010                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29011                                  
 29012                                  InitVar:
 29013                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29014                                  	push	ax
 29015                                  	push	cx
 29016                                  	push	di
 29017                                  	push	es
 29018                                  
 29019                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29020                                  	push	cs
 29021                                  	pop	es
 29022                                  
 29023                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29024                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29025                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29026                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29027                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29028                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29029                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29030                                  
 29031                                  	cld
 29032                                  
 29033                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29034                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29035                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29036                                  
 29037                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29038                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29039                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29040                                  
 29041                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29042                                  
 29043                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29044                                  	pop	es
 29045                                  	pop	di
 29046                                  	pop	cx
 29047                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29048                                  
 29049                                  	retn
 29050                                  
 29051                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29052                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29053                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29054                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29055                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29056                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29057                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29058                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29059                                  
 29060                                  FixMem:
 29061                                  	push	ax
 29062                                  	push	bx
 29063                                  	push	cx
 29064                                  	push	dx
 29065                                  	push	es
 29066                                  
 29067                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29068                                  
 29069                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29070                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29071                                  
 29072                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29073                                  
 29074                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29075                                  
 29076                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29077                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29078                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29079                                  
 29080                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29081                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29082                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29083                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29084                                  
 29085                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29086                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29087                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29088                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29089                                  
 29090                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29091                                  
 29092                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29093                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29094                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29095                                  
 29096                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29097                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29098                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29099                                  
 29100                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29101                                  
 29102                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29103                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29104                                  
 29105                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29106                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29107                                  	inc	bx
 29108                                  	mov	es,bx
 29109                                  
 29110                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29111                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29112                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29113                                  fmX:	
 29114                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29115                                  
 29116                                  	pop	es
 29117                                  	pop	dx
 29118                                  	pop	cx
 29119                                  	pop	bx
 29120                                  	pop	ax
 29121                                  
 29122                                  	retn
 29123                                  
 29124                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29125                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29126                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29127                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29128                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29129                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29130                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29131                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29132                                  
 29133                                  fm_link:
 29134                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29135                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29136                                  
 29137                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29138                                  	;
 29139                                  	;push	es
 29140                                  	;push	cs
 29141                                  	;pop	es
 29142                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29143                                  	;pop	es
 29144                                  	
 29145                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29146                                  
 29147                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29148                                  	mov	bx,1
 29149                                  	int	21h
 29150                                  	retn
 29151                                  
 29152                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29153                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29154                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29155                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29156                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29157                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29158                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29159                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29160                                  
 29161                                  fm_unlink:
 29162                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29163                                  	
 29164                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29165                                  	;
 29166                                  	;push	ds
 29167                                  	;push	cs
 29168                                  	;pop	ds
 29169                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29170                                  	;pop	ds
 29171                                  	
 29172                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29173                                  
 29174                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29175                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29176                                  	retn
 29177                                  
 29178                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29179                                  
 29180                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29181                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29182                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29183                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29184                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29185                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
