 29186                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29187                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29188                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29189                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29190                                  ;
 29191                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29192                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29193                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29194                                  ;
 29195                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29196                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29197                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29198                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29199                                  ;
 29200                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29201                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29202                                  ;
 29203                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29204                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29205                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29206                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29207                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29208                                  ;     lh
 29209                                  ;     /l
 29210                                  ;     1
 29211                                  ;     1000
 29212                                  ;     2
 29213                                  ;     print
 29214                                  ;     /d
 29215                                  ;     :lpt2
 29216                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29217                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29218                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29219                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29220                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29221                                  ; for:
 29222                                  ;    Each /L
 29223                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29224                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29225                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29226                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29227                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29228                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29229                                  
 29230                                  ParseVar:
 29231                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29232                                  	push	di
 29233                                  	push	ds
 29234                                  	push	es
 29235                                  
 29236                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29237                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29238                                  	cld
 29239                                  
 29240                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29241                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29242                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29243                                  
 29244                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29245                                  	call	isWhite
 29246                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29247                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29248                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29249                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29250                                  
 29251                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29252                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29253                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29254                                  
 29255                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29256                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29257                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29258                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29259                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29260                                  	jne	short pv30
 29261                                  
 29262                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29263                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29264                                  
 29265                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29266                                  	;
 29267                                  	;push	es
 29268                                  	;push	cs
 29269                                  	;pop	es
 29270                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29271                                  	;pop	es
 29272                                  
 29273                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29274                                  
 29275                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29276                                  
 29277                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29278                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29279                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29280                                  
 29281                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29282                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29283                                  
 29284                                  	call	parseL
 29285                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29286                                  
 29287                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29288                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29289                                  
 29290                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29291                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29292                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29293                                  	dec	si
 29294                                  	stc
 29295                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29296                                  	pop	es
 29297                                  	pop	ds
 29298                                  	pop	di
 29299                                  	retn
 29300                                  
 29301                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29302                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29303                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29304                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29305                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29306                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29307                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29308                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29309                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29310                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29311                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29312                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29313                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29314                                  
 29315                                  parseL:
 29316                                  	lodsb
 29317                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29318                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29319                                  
 29320                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29321                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29322                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29323                                  
 29324                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29325                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29326                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29327                                  
 29328                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29329                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29330                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29331                                  
 29332                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29333                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29334                                  
 29335                                  	lodsb
 29336                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29337                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29338                                  
 29339                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29340                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29341                                  
 29342                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29343                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29344                                  
 29345                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29346                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29347                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29348                                  
 29349                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29350                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29351                                  
 29352                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29353                                  
 29354                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29355                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29356                                  
 29357                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29358                                  
 29359                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29360                                  
 29361                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29362                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29363                                  
 29364                                  	lodsb
 29365                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29366                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29367                                  
 29368                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29369                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29370                                  
 29371                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29372                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29373                                  
 29374                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29375                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29376                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29377                                  plE1:	
 29378                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29379                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29380                                  	dec	si
 29381                                  	stc
 29382                                  	retn
 29383                                  
 29384                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29385                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29386                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29387                                  	; cf=1
 29388                                  	;stc
 29389                                  	retn
 29390                                  plSwX:	
 29391                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29392                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29393                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29394                                  	; cf=0
 29395                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29396                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29397                                  
 29398                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29399                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29400                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29401                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29402                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29403                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29404                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29406                                  
 29407                                  ;incArgc:
 29408                                  	;push	ax
 29409                                  
 29410                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29411                                  
 29412                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29413                                  
 29414                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29415                                  
 29416                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29417                                  
 29418                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29419                                  
 29420                                  	;pop	ax
 29421                                  	;retn
 29422                                  
 29423                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29424                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29425                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29426                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29427                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29428                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29429                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29430                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29431                                  
 29432                                  isEOL:
 29433                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29434                                  	je	short ieX
 29435                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29436                                  	je	short ieX
 29437                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29438                                  ieX:	
 29439                                  	retn
 29440                                  
 29441                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29442                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29443                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29444                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29445                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29446                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29447                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29448                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29449                                  
 29450                                  isWhite:
 29451                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29452                                  	je	short iwX
 29453                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29454                                  	je	short iwX
 29455                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29456                                  iwX:	
 29457                                  	retn
 29458                                  
 29459                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29460                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29461                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29462                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29463                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29464                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29465                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29466                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29467                                  
 29468                                  unMarkUMB:
 29469                                  	push	ax
 29470                                  	push	bx
 29471                                  	push	di
 29472                                  	push	es
 29473                                  
 29474                                  	push	cs
 29475                                  	pop	es
 29476                                  
 29477                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29478                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29479                                  
 29480                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29481                                  	
 29482                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29483                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29484                                  
 29485                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29486                                  	jne	short umu10
 29487                                  
 29488                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29489                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29490                                  umu10:	
 29491                                  	pop	es
 29492                                  	pop	di
 29493                                  	pop	bx
 29494                                  	pop	ax
 29495                                  	retn
 29496                                  
 29497                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29498                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29499                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29500                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29501                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29502                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29503                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29504                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29505                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29506                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29507                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29508                                  
 29509                                  stowUMB:
 29510                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29511                                  	jb	short su10
 29512                                  	stc
 29513                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29514                                  su10:	
 29515                                  	push	bx
 29516                                  	push	di
 29517                                  	push	si
 29518                                  	push	ds
 29519                                  	push	es
 29520                                  	push	cs
 29521                                  	pop	es
 29522                                  	push	cs
 29523                                  	pop	ds
 29524                                  	
 29525                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29526                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29527                                  	jne	short su20
 29528                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29529                                  su20:	
 29530                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29531                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29532                                  
 29533                                  	mov	bl,al
 29534                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29535                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29536                                  
 29537                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29538                                  
 29539                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29540                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29541                                  
 29542                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29543                                  su30:	
 29544                                  	pop	es
 29545                                  	pop	ds
 29546                                  	pop	si
 29547                                  	pop	di
 29548                                  	pop	bx
 29549                                  	retn
 29550                                  
 29551                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29552                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29553                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29554                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29555                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29556                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29557                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29558                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29559                                  
 29560                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29561                                  
 29562                                  stowSiz:
 29563                                  	push	bx
 29564                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29565                                  	push	es
 29566                                  
 29567                                  	push	cs
 29568                                  	pop	es	
 29569                                  
 29570                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29571                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29572                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29573                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29574                                  	
 29575                                  	pop	es
 29576                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29577                                  	pop	bx
 29578                                  
 29579                                  	retn
 29580                                  
 29581                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29582                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29583                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29584                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29585                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29586                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29587                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29588                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29589                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29590                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29591                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29592                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29593                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29594                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29595                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29596                                  
 29597                                  gnradix:
 29598                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29599                                  
 29600                                  toDigit:
 29601                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29602                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29603                                  
 29604                                  toDigit_hex:
 29605                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29606                                  	jb	short td10
 29607                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29608                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29609                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29610                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29611                                  	retn
 29612                                  td10:	
 29613                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29614                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29615                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29616                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29617                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29618                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29619                                  	retn
 29620                                  toDigit_dec:
 29621                                  td20:	
 29622                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29623                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29624                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29625                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29626                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29627                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29628                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29629                                  	retn
 29630                                  tdE:	
 29631                                  	stc
 29632                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29633                                  	retn
 29634                                  
 29635                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29636                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29637                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29638                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29639                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29640                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29641                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29642                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29643                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29644                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29645                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29646                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29647                                  
 29648                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29649                                  
 29650                                  GetXNum:
 29651                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29652                                  	push	bx
 29653                                  	push	cx
 29654                                  	push	ds
 29655                                  
 29656                                  	cld
 29657                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29658                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29659                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29660                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29661                                  
 29662                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29663                                  
 29664                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29665                                  	;call	toDigit
 29666                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29667                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29668                                  
 29669                                  	or	cl,cl
 29670                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29671                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29672                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29673                                  	je	short gxn10
 29674                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29675                                  	jne	short gxn20
 29676                                  
 29677                                  gxn10:	
 29678                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29679                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29680                                  	inc	si
 29681                                  
 29682                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29683                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29684                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 29685                                  ;        BX    = 0
 29686                                  ;        CH    = 0
 29687                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29688                                  
 29689                                  gxn20:	
 29690                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 29691                                  	inc	si
 29692                                  
 29693                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 29694                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 29695                                  
 29696                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 29697                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 29698                                  
 29699                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 29700                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 29701                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 29702                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 29703                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 29704                                  gxnE:	
 29705                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 29706                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 29707                                  gxnQ:	
 29708                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 29709                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 29710                                  gxnX:	
 29711                                  	pop	ds
 29712                                  	pop	cx
 29713                                  	pop	bx
 29714                                  	retn
 29715                                  
 29716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29717                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 29718                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29719                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 29720                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 29721                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 29722                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29723                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29724                                  
 29725                                  mul32:
 29726                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29727                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29728                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29729                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 29730                                  
 29731                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29732                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29733                                  
 29734                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29735                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29736                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29737                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29738                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29739                                  	retn
 29740                                  m32E:	
 29741                                  	pop	ax
 29742                                  	retn
 29743                                  
 29744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29745                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 29746                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29747                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 29748                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 29749                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29750                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29751                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29752                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 29753                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 29754                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29755                                  
 29756                                  toPara:
 29757                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 29758                                  
 29759                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 29760                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 29761                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 29762                                  	mov	cl,12
 29763                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 29764                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 29765                                  
 29766                                  	pop	cx
 29767                                  	retn
 29768                                  
 29769                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29770                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 29771                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29772                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 29773                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 29774                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 29775                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29776                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29777                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 29778                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 29779                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 29780                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 29781                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29782                                  
 29783                                  UmbHead:
 29784                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 29785                                  
 29786                                  	;push	si ; ?
 29787                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 29788                                  	;push	es
 29789                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 29790                                  
 29791                                  	; 09/04/2019
 29792                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 29793                                  
 29794                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 29795                                  	int	21h
 29796                                  
 29797                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 29798                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29799                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 29800                                  
 29801                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 29802                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 29803                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29804                                  	retn
 29805                                  uhE:	
 29806                                  	stc
 29807                                  uhX:	
 29808                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 29809                                  	;pop	es
 29810                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 29811                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 29812                                  	retn
 29813                                  
 29814                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29815                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 29816                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29817                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 29818                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 29819                                  ; USES:   Flags
 29820                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29821                                  
 29822                                  isSysMCB:
 29823                                  	;push	ax
 29824                                  
 29825                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 29826                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 29827                                  	;je	short ism10
 29828                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 29829                                  	;;je	short ism10
 29830                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 29831                                  	;jne	short ismX
 29832                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 29833                                  	jne	short ismX 
 29834                                  ism10:	
 29835                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 29836                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 29837                                  	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 29838                                  ismX:	
 29839                                  	;pop	ax
 29840                                  	retn
 29841                                  
 29842                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29843                                  
 29844                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29845                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 29846                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29847                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 29848                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 29849                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 29850                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29852                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 29853                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 29854                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 29855                                  ;      ...
 29856                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 29857                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29858                                  
 29859                                  AddrToUmb:
 29860                                  	push	cx
 29861                                  	push	dx
 29862                                  	push	es
 29863                                  
 29864                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 29865                                  
 29866                                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 29867                                  	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 29868                                  
 29869                                  	mov	es,ax		; ES = first UMB segment
 29870                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 29871                                  
 29872                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29873                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 29874                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 29875                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 29876                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 29877                                  
 29878                                  atu10:	mov	ax,es
 29879                                          cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 29880                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 29881                                  
 29882                                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 29883                                  	jnz	short atu20
 29884                                  
 29885                                  	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 29886                                  atu20:	
 29887                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 29888                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 29889                                  	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 29890                                  
 29891                                  	;NextMCB es, ax
 29892                                  
 29893                                  	mov     ax,es
 29894                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 29895                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29896                                  	inc     ax
 29897                                  	mov     es,ax
 29898                                  	
 29899                                  	jmp	short atu10
 29900                                  
 29901                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29902                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 29903                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 29904                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29905                                  
 29906                                  atu30:	
 29907                                  	mov	ax,es
 29908                                  	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29909                                  	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 29910                                  	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 29911                                  atuE:	
 29912                                  	xor	cx,cx		; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 29913                                  	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 29914                                  atuX:	
 29915                                  	mov	ax, cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 29916                                  	
 29917                                  	pop	es	
 29918                                  	pop	dx
 29919                                  	pop	cx
 29920                                  	retn
 29921                                  
 29922                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29923                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 29924                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 29925                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 29926                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 29927                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29928                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 29929                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 29930                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29931                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29932                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29933                                  
 29934                                  convUMB:
 29935                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29936                                  	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 29937                                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 29938                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29939                                  	jne	short cu10
 29940                                  	inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 29941                                  cu10:	
 29942                                  	retn
 29943                                  
 29944                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29945                                  ;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 29946                                  ;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 29947                                  ; of the usual HIGH_FIRST.  See the code.
 29948                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29949                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29950                                  ; EXIT:   None
 29951                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29952                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29953                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29954                                  
 29955                                  setUMBs:
 29956                                  	push	ax
 29957                                  	push	bx
 29958                                  	call	fm_link
 29959                                  	pop	bx
 29960                                  	pop	ax
 29961                                  	retn
 29962                                  
 29963                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29964                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 29965                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29966                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 29967                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 29968                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 29969                                  ; ERROR:  None
 29970                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 29971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29972                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 29973                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0.  That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 29974                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 29975                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 29976                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29977                                  
 29978                                  loadLow:
 29979                                  	;push	ds
 29980                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 29981                                  	;pop	ds	
 29982                                  
 29983                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 29984                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 29985                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 29986                                  	jne	short ll10
 29987                                  
 29988                                  	stc
 29989                                  ll15:
 29990                                  	mov	al,1		; Return with AL==1 && STC if no UMBs specified
 29991                                  	;stc
 29992                                  	;jmp	short llX
 29993                                  	retn
 29994                                  ll10:	
 29995                                  	or	al,al		; AL=the load UMB: Is it == 0?
 29996                                  	;jz	short llX	; Yep... CF==0 (from OR) && AL=0, so just exit
 29997                                  
 29998                                  	jnz	short ll15	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29999                                  	retn
 30000                                  
 30001                                  	;mov	al,1
 30002                                  	;clc
 30003                                  ;llX:
 30004                                  	;pop	ds		; Return DS to where it was
 30005                                  	;retn
 30006                                  
 30007                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30008                                  ;*** HideUMBs - links UMBs and hides upper-memory as appropriate
 30009                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30010                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30011                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30012                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30013                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 30014                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30015                                  
 30016                                  HideUMBs:
 30017                                  	push	ax
 30018                                  	push	cx
 30019                                  	push	ds
 30020                                  	push	es
 30021                                  
 30022                                  	call	UmbTest		; See if we REALLY linked in anything...
 30023                                  	jc	short husX	; ...if not, there's nothing for us to do.
 30024                                  
 30025                                  	call	FixMem		; Concatenate adjacent free MCBs in upper mem
 30026                                  	call	setUMBs		; Link UMBs and set memory-allocation strategy
 30027                                  
 30028                                  	;putdata fInHigh,1	; Remember that we're now running high
 30029                                  	mov	byte [cs:fInHigh],1
 30030                                  
 30031                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; See if they gave us a list to leave free
 30032                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30033                                  
 30034                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED	; If they didn't,
 30035                                  	je	short husX	; then we shouldn't do this loop:
 30036                                  
 30037                                  	xor	cx,cx
 30038                                  
 30039                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30040                                  ; HUS10-CX - UMB number (after inc, 1==first UMB)
 30041                                  ; -----------------------------------------------
 30042                                  
 30043                                  hus10:	inc	cx		; For each UMB:
 30044                                  	cmp	cx,MAXUMB ; 16
 30045                                  	jae	short hus20
 30046                                  
 30047                                  	mov	al,cl		; (stopping as soon as we're outside of the
 30048                                  	push	es
 30049                                  	call	findUMB		; valid range of UMBs)
 30050                                  	pop	es		; push/pop: trash what findumb finds.  :-)
 30051                                  	jc	short hus20
 30052                                  
 30053                                  	call	_hideUMB_	; hide what we need to hide.
 30054                                  
 30055                                  	jmp	short hus10
 30056                                  hus20:	
 30057                                  	;call	GetLoadUMB	; Now check if they offered /L:0
 30058                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad] ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30059                                  
 30060                                  	or	al,al		; --Is the load UMB 0? (-1==unspecified)
 30061                                  	jnz	short husX	; If not, we're done.
 30062                                  
 30063                                  	call	hl_unlink	; If so, however, fix UMBs and strategy.
 30064                                  husX:	
 30065                                  	pop	es
 30066                                  	pop	ds
 30067                                  	pop	cx
 30068                                  	pop	ax
 30069                                  	retn
 30070                                  
 30071                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30072                                  ;*** GetLoadUMB - Returns the load UMB number in AL (-1 if not specified)
 30073                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30074                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30075                                  ; EXIT:   AL == load UMB
 30076                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30077                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30078                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30079                                  
 30080                                  ;GetLoadUMB:
 30081                                  ;	;getdata al, UmbLoad
 30082                                  ;	push	ds
 30083                                  ;	push	cs
 30084                                  ;	pop	ds
 30085                                  ;	mov	al,[UmLoad]
 30086                                  ;	pop	ds
 30087                                  ;	retn
 30088                                  
 30089                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30090                                  ;*** GetLoadSize - Returns the load UMB minimum size (0 if not specified)
 30091                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30092                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 30093                                  ; EXIT:   AX == load UMB minimum size
 30094                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30095                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30096                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30097                                  
 30098                                  GetLoadSize:
 30099                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30100                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30101                                  	jmp	short GetSize
 30102                                  
 30103                                  	;push	bx
 30104                                  	;;push	si
 30105                                  	;push	ds
 30106                                  	;push	cs
 30107                                  	;pop	ds
 30108                                  
 30109                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 30110                                  
 30111                                  	;xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 30112                                  	;mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 30113                                  	;shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 30114                                  	;;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 30115                                  	;;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 30116                                  
 30117                                  	;;lodsw				;    ax==size
 30118                                  
 30119                                  	;add	bx,ax
 30120                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 30121                                  
 30122                                  	;pop	ds
 30123                                  	;;pop	si
 30124                                  	;pop	bx
 30125                                  	;retn
 30126                                  
 30127                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30128                                  ;*** GetSize - Returns the UMB in AL's minimum size (0 if not specified)
 30129                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30130                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == a UMB number
 30131                                  ; EXIT:   AX == UMB minimum size, as specified by the user
 30132                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30133                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30135                                  
 30136                                  GetSize:
 30137                                  	; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30138                                  
 30139                                  	push	bx
 30140                                  	;push	si
 30141                                  	;push	ds
 30142                                  	;push	cs
 30143                                  	;pop	ds
 30144                                  
 30145                                  	xor	ah,ah			;    ax==UMB
 30146                                  	mov	bx,UmbSize		;    bx==array
 30147                                  	shl	al,1	                ;    ax==offset
 30148                                  	;add	ax,bx			;    ax==element index
 30149                                  	;mov	si,ax			; ds:si==element index
 30150                                  
 30151                                  	;lodsw				;    ax==size
 30152                                  
 30153                                  	add	bx,ax
 30154                                  	;mov	ax,[bx]
 30155                                  	mov	ax,[cs:bx]
 30156                                  
 30157                                  	;pop	ds
 30158                                  	;pop	si
 30159                                  	pop	bx
 30160                                  	retn
 30161                                  
 30162                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30163                                  ;*** StoLoadUMB - Overrides the load UMB number with what's in AL
 30164                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30165                                  ; ENTRY:   AL == new load UMB
 30166                                  ; EXIT:    None
 30167                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30168                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX
 30169                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30170                                  ; CAUTION: Should only be used if /L:... was used.  Logically, that is the only
 30171                                  ;          time you would ever need this, so that's okay.
 30172                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30173                                  
 30174                                  ;StoLoadUMB:
 30175                                  ;	;putdata UmbLoad, al
 30176                                  ;	push	es
 30177                                  ;	push	cs
 30178                                  ;	pop	es
 30179                                  ;	mov	[es:UmbLoad],al
 30180                                  ;	pop	es
 30181                                  ;	retn
 30182                                  
 30183                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30184                                  ;*** StoLoadSize - Overrides the load UMB minimum size with what's in AX
 30185                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30186                                  ; ENTRY:  AL == new load size
 30187                                  ; EXIT:   None
 30188                                  ; ERROR:  None
 30189                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30190                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30191                                  
 30192                                  StoLoadSize:
 30193                                  	push	dx
 30194                                  
 30195                                  	;getdata dl, UmbLoad		; Put UMB# in DL and size in AX
 30196                                  	;
 30197                                  	;push	ds
 30198                                  	;push	cs
 30199                                  	;pop	ds
 30200                                  	;mov	dl,[UmbLoad]
 30201                                  	;pop	ds	
 30202                                  
 30203                                  	mov	dl,[cs:UmbLoad]
 30204                                  
 30205                                  	cmp	dl,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30206                                  	je	short sls10
 30207                                  
 30208                                  	call	stowSiz			; We've got a function to do just this
 30209                                  sls10:	
 30210                                  	pop	dx
 30211                                  	retn
 30212                                  
 30213                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30214                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 30215                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30216                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 30217                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 30218                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30219                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30220                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30221                                  
 30222                                  hideUMB:
 30223                                  	push	ax
 30224                                  	push	es
 30225                                  
 30226                                  	call	findUMB		; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 30227                                  	jc	short huX
 30228                                  
 30229                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30230                                  ; HU10--ES - MCB inside UMB; if it's a system MCB,
 30231                                  ;            we're not in the same UMB, so exit.
 30232                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30233                                  
 30234                                  hu10:	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 30235                                  	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 30236                                  	;call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 30237                                  	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 30238                                  	jnz	short hu20
 30239                                  
 30240                                  	call	hideMCB
 30241                                  hu20:	
 30242                                  	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 30243                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ;'Z'
 30244                                  	jz	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 30245                                  
 30246                                  	;NextMCB es, ax		; Go on forward.
 30247                                  	mov     ax,es
 30248                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 30249                                  	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30250                                  	inc     ax
 30251                                  	mov     es,ax
 30252                                  
 30253                                  	jmp	short hu10
 30254                                  huX:	
 30255                                  	pop	es
 30256                                  	pop	ax
 30257                                  	retn
 30258                                  
 30259                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30260                                  ;*** isTiny - returns with ZF set if user didn't specify /S
 30261                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30262                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30263                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if user DIDN'T specify /S
 30264                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30265                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30266                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30267                                  
 30268                                  isTiny:
 30269                                  	push	ax
 30270                                  
 30271                                  	;getdata al, fUmbTiny
 30272                                  	;
 30273                                  	;push	ds
 30274                                  	;push	cs
 30275                                  	;pop	ds
 30276                                  	;mov	al,[fUmbTiny]
 30277                                  	;pop	ds
 30278                                  
 30279                                  	mov	al,[cs:fUmbTiny]		
 30280                                  
 30281                                  	or	al,al
 30282                                  	pop	ax
 30283                                  	retn
 30284                                  
 30285                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30286                                  ;*** isFreeMCB - returns with ZF set if current MCB (ES:0) is FREE
 30287                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30288                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 30289                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if MCB is free, else !ZF
 30290                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30291                                  ; USES:     Flags
 30292                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30293                                  
 30294                                  ;isFreeMCB:
 30295                                  ;	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 30296                                  ;	retn
 30297                                  
 30298                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30299                                  ;*** hideMCB - marks as HIDDEN the MCB at ES:0
 30300                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30301                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:0 should point to an MCB
 30302                                  ; EXIT:     None; MCB marked as HIDDEN
 30303                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30304                                  ; USES:     None
 30305                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30306                                  
 30307                                  hideMCB:
 30308                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8
 30309                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+0], 'HI' ; 4948h
 30310                                  	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME+2], 'DD' ; 4444h
